Ok Cartel... I've been a regular customer for years.  I love the coffee, the tea, and the cool vibe.  But today at the Tempe location, I stayed for an hour and a half for a business meeting and came out to a "warning" from TEAM security on my car.  "1 HR means 1 HR"?!  Really?

I'll just go to literally ANY other coffee shop next time.

5 star coffee, easily the best coffee in the whole valley. The service has gotten much better. It used to be where the baristas were total snobs, and looked down upon you. I think maybe you need to be a hipster to get smile and good service. A paying customer who loves good coffee isn't good enough. But like I said, they are much more cordial now. I would go more often, but I don't like the dungeon dark feeling in the place. They should open that back more, add some natural light ambience. It takes forever to get your coffee, but its fresh and delicious. Coffee 5 stars, everything else, 1 to 2, Therefore a 3 star rating.

This place is legit!  It's nice to have a change from other typical lame coffee shops that you see in airports.  I got the "Iced Dirty Chai Latte", and it didn't disappoint!  If I find myself in this airport in the middle of the desert again, I'll be coming back.  Good job guys.

PS  Kinda reminds me of the Better Buzz Lab in San Diego, CA (Pacific Beach)

I am really impressed with this coffee shop! I wasn't expecting to be wowed because lets face it, in downtown Phoenix you can throw a stone in any direction and run into one. Upon walking in I was immediately greeted with great decor and friendly employees. My drink was made quickly and was definitely worth the walk. I suggest trying this location if you are looking for a good alternative to your typical coffee chain.

Not that I would ever go to a coffee shop just to watch people...but here my friend and I kind of did. Ha! ok ok so there are alot of interesting people that come in this place. Nothing like I have ever seen atleast. Then again I am not into the college scene, so I don't know. But anyway. the coffee is super good. The cookies are amazing. This shop is definitely funky and cool. Not too cozy as far as big chairs or whatnot. So that's my only beef. But i would definitely come back to this place. And the staff was pretty darn friendly too!

Let me start this negative review by saying that I do adore Cartel's cobb salad.  Adore.

But I'm going to go out on a limb and say it should not take 20-30 minutes to make a cobb salad.  That's happened to me at least twice now.  The first time, the only person in the shop who could make a salad, apparently, went out to eat lunch...so I had to wait to eat lunch.  The second time, to be fair, I didn't time exactly how long it took, but I was able to listen to almost all of the new Rihanna album before I finally got up and asked for a status update.  And apparently, my salad had been sitting for who knows how long in the back.

I have now been to Cartel enough times so I know how to make this salad myself.  And I'm not going back.
Doing Specialty Coffee right in the Old Town. So nice to see a place that is putting their foot down and not even offering foo foo corporate nonsense coffee. This is the real deal here. Nice work!

I am a huge coffee fan so when I a heard about this place I was excited to check it out. It's great that there's another independent coffee house in downtown Scottsdale.

I liked the decor, free wifi, and the staff was friendly enough. I ordered a black coffee from Guatemala which was a little weak for my taste - I'll try something else next time.

I usually drink 4-5 cups of coffee house coffee per day and found the $4.25 (5.25 after tip) expensive for drip coffee. It was served in a pint glass which was strange but OK with the sleeve. 

I'll stop by again but I gave it 4 stars because it's a little expensive to make it a regular place.
Great coffee, nice environment. Just moved to town and was glad to find a nice coffee spot right away with knowledgeable baristas. Grabbed a pour over and a shot of espresso - both were tasty.

Very good coffee. Interestingly the brewed coffee is a lighter roast.  I asked why light and they replayed that use lots of beans to get the flavor and not cover flavor with a dark roast.  Interesting and a concept I am going to try.
Best coffee! Made in an artisan way. Each cup individually made.  greAt atmosphere looks totally hip. Good music. Very clean.  Very polite patrons hangout and converse.

Cartel is full of coffee geniuses. They really care about their product. I've also been to the one in Tempe, where they took the time to discuss proper brewing technique. They'll give you more than you ever wanted to know: time, temperature, coffee/water ratio, etc. They even gave free samples to help us purchase beans.

Amazing coffee! Truly a one-of-a-kind coffee flavor experience. 
I'd agree with some of the other reviews that this place definitely has a hipster vibe, but thankfully the staff was kind and helpful. 
The "condiment" bar only had some cane sugar syrup and I had to ask the barista for some cream- just a heads up.

I was really excited to try this place when I first moved out to Tempe, and even more excited to get a real macchiato. The coffee is great, but the customer service is hit or miss. As much as I would like to make this an every day go-to, I just can't justify the time it takes to recieve an order. I get it, great things take time, but unfortunately I can't leave 20 min early just to get a cup of coffee before work or school.

TL;DR
great place if you have time and patience. Not a good pre work/class stop

I recently arrived in Phoenix and as a professional barista both in the USA and Australia (I'm Australian) for well over a decade, I immediately went looking for decent coffee.

I was told that Cartel was the goods, so I checked it out.
Ordering an espresso tests the barista's skill level, as there is no milk to cover up any shortcomings in technique, the roast and the beans themselves.

The drink I received had a rather pale crema, which tends to indicate underextraction. A quick taste confirmed this with astringency, sour taste and extremely thin mouthfeel.

I took the beverage back where the barista tried to tell me that it was my fault that the drink was unpalatable. Because I hadn't finished it, it was now stale. 
But the reality was that I didn't finish it because it was unpalatable.

The barista agreed to remake the beverage again, this time, to her credit it was far more palatable.

Still, blaming the customer for your shortcomings is very poor form.

What a wonderful place! Staff always so knowledgeable and helpful. Not to mention the coffee is extremely tasteful! I crave their dirty chias! If you're looking for a place to settle down and do some business or school work, it is a great environment for just that!

Cartel Coffee is one of my favorite places to get coffee and work. Some coffee places rush you and don't want you to hang out and work. But Cartel actually has a pretty good business environment. I also really like their coffee. The iced mocha is the best in town - and I've had mochas from every other coffee shop. I highly recommend Cartel.
My granddaughter and I rate Cartel the BEST Chai in Phoenix. We treat ourselves everytime I have an opportunity to pick her up from school! She gets iced and I love it hot:)

Pretty cool place to hang out. Like a lot of people is saying, this has a hipster vibe. I like this place and I like their iced chai. Plenty of seating, but have always been packed whenever I go , so it's harder to go with a friend. I like that they've added the extension of the coffee bar to the other side with booth-like sitting room along with high-top tables.
Cool little place to chill on a Saturday morning. Great coffee, and the coconut scone was delicious.
Wasn't expecting an amazing cappuccino in the desert, but this place could rival many of my favorite spots back in Seattle!

I loved Cartel for a long time but slowly realized the amount of aloofness given off by the patrons. Always delicious coffee and their score shouldn't necessarily be penalized for the "better than you" vibes given off by the customers, but a few times I've gotten less than perfect service from the baristas, who given, are doing all they can to keep things flowing. They are often very busy but wait times to order are not too long. Extra points to them for the latte art.

Cartel is a great Phoenix cup of coffee. I have to admit, when you're in NYC, SF, LA, in particular-- you're exposed to some of the best coffee in the world. 
When you're in Phoenix, however; Cartel is a quite decent local roastery. My go-to drink is a Gibraltar. If you have a palate for smooth espresso and you're able to diffentiate quality from garbage.... you will appreciate this place :) Ambiance is great too at all locations. I'm not giving it 5 starts because their restrooms are horrendous. Regardless of gender, I prefer Male & Female restrooms to be separate. Men simply are not as clean as women when it comes to restroom cleanliness. I honestly think they would draw in more people and have even more repeat customers if they invested in revamping the restrooms at both the Tempe & Scottsdale locations.

Cartel is fine. I go here a lot because I live right next door.

Cons - The service is hit-or-miss. They have a small staff and are pretty busy so it's usually about a ten minute wait from entrance to exit if you're getting coffee to go. The line takes a few minutes and the drink takes a few minutes. 

Pros - The coffee really is good. The people that make the drinks are skilled and everything comes out delicious. The atmosphere is artsy, funky and fun. 

Prices are okay. About the same as Starbucks and more expensive than Xtreme Bean, but a better product for sure.

I think Cartel has cultivated a loyal following of people that come for the coffee. Convenience is probably also a factor because of the sweet location. If you really care about high-quality coffee, I'd say it's worth the effort. If you're just in the mood for an iced chai, you'd be better off going to wherever's closest to you.
They feature a different black coffee each day - super unique and they tell you not just the country but more specifically where it's from. Great vibe for business or catching up with friends.
Love this this place the drinks are kinda pricy for the size but overall the dirty chai is the best !

I love this dark, hipster coffee shop. It's really easy to set up shop and get some work done here. There are a ton of couches and tables, but it can be difficult to find space right away. It can get pretty busy with college students who stay most of the morning to get work done. They coffee is pretty straight forward. They don't have a ton of flavors like Starbucks, but it's a great place to get a good quality latte or americano if you like the taste of coffee and not sugar syrup. They also serve beer in the 21 and over section (in the back where the couches are) I tried a coffee kolcsh they had a while back and it was delicious. I think they only have 3 taps so they won't have a ton of beer selection and they'll probably focus on craft beers.

This place is hidden in a strip mall very close to ASU and when I walked in I was surprised how large it is. Very funky with lots of tables, benches, counters, couches to study or work at. Quiet enough to concentrate with music as background noise more than anything. Chill atmosphere and will definitely be back. Hopefully next time I'm here there are pillows for the seating - that'd make this place 5*.

the coffee here tastes like berries. I was told by a barista at another coffee shop that it should taste like berries, since coffee beans are actually seeds from coffee berries.

I've had the daily coffee and cold brew and I got the same bright, fruity flavor.

the staff was very friendly and prompt with service. there is plenty of seating around, now that they have expanded. they have wifi, but it seems a little bit too loud for studying. it's a super hip place and a good place to hang or meet up with friends.

Gotta love the vibe at Cartel. Before I even get to the coffee, the place itself deserves recognition. Local art, some for sale, covers the walls and is always changing. The music is always spot on, the couches are comfy, and when you leave your clothes smell like a nice dark roast for the rest of the day (I suppose some may not like this but I rather enjoy it). 

As for the coffee, prepare to get your buzz on. I always get a hell of a pick me up from my go to Cartel Americano. Exceptional flavor, fresh, and just as good iced as it is hot, they rarely disappoint. My only complaint is the cost, but considering their support of local art and business, I can deal with the additional charge.

I ordered a breakfast burrito and a latte TO GO.

The burrito was delivered in less than 5 minutes. After that I sat and waited an additional 10 minutes for the latte. There were 4 people waiting for coffee when I ordered. 

I get it that they take their coffee seriously here but 15 minutes for a latte when it's dead?? 

Burrito was ruined/inedible because the potatoes were basically raw.

Tucked in to a non-descript strip mall, this is the best coffee in town.  The clover machine puts out a perfect steaming cup of coffee, one at a time, and the iced toddy (cold brewed) is amazing.  They use high quality, organic milks for all the lattes, etc., and my wife swears by the chai latte.  Only thing missing is perhaps some pastries (tammie coe, anyone?), but that's it.  The service is always great.  If I didn't live so close by I'd still make the trek over without a doubt.

I had a great chai latte here.. no overly empressed with the service. I think they guys working could have been a bit friendlier but maybe they were on edge because of how hot it was inside. I did enjoy the atmosphere however. Most importantly the coffe was great!

Cartel provides a much more personal cup than competitors, with their great customer service and care taken in making the product taste perfect as well. Don't know how they did it, but the latte was delivered at perfect temperature and I didn't burn my mouth which is a rarity.

After asking where the list of flavors were for a latte he said we have agave we have... Stop. I will have an agave latte. Great ambiance in this hipstery coffee shop. There's plenty of room to sit but everything is metal, wood, and concrete so the seats are cold. Make sure to grab a hot beverage to warm your bum! Next visit I will be choosing from their SIX different types of coffees.

Had a wonderful experience at Cartel. Great pour over and gluten free muffin. I like the fact that they give you a number of different brewing option to choose from. Staff was friendly and informative.
Great espresso, calm enough atmosphere to get work done, better than the library for any equivalent task. The scene is not that exclusive or snobbish from my experience, despite what others say.
Best chai tea latte I have ever had...like E.V.E.R.  Wish they were on the Belly local rewards program.

The most fabulous coffee in the city. 
The best service once you warm up to the barristers
& a sustainability crusader!
Got a 12 oz Guatemalan as pour over. Tasted watered down/a little sour and was way too hot. For $5 I would have expected a better cup. Staff was nice enough.

Great place with some great drink. The decor inside is unique, and the staff was friendly to me. My only beef with this place is sitting inside may not suit your level of comfort. It was a little louder than I expected, and while sitting on the limited amount of chairs is alright, the hard benches will put your butt to sleep in minutes. I was watching a couple of students wiggling and suffering while on their laptops lol.

I used to live down the street from this place and would walk there almost every morning. My drink of choice is an iced Americano: super strong, smooth and delicious. I get the dirty chai when I'm looking for something sweet. They have good quality organic milk and soy milk and make their own horchata. The inside is decorated with local art and murals. 

My only complaints are:
1.) Sometimes it takes a long time for them to make your drink. Like 15 minutes long. (But I'll gladly wait around for quality.) 
2.) Maybe it's the way they roast their beans, but a large Americano has me wired for hours!!! No exaggeration, I've had a drink at 2 pm and still couldn't sleep by 10.

Go if: you like great coffee

Don't go if: you don't like slow service, rude baristas and unnecessarily loud music

Still, great coffee and espresso though.

Well done, Cartel.  Well done!

I am in town for business, and needed a cup of coffee that is nearby.  Not having a rental car, I needed something within walking distance of my hotel ... who knew I would luck out and find this hidden gem so close! Not only was I very glad that I didn't have to fall back on my "safety cup" (SBUX - also nearby.  After all, when aren't they?) but I was very pleased with both the quality of the coffee as well as the friendliness of the barista.  (She happily shared that she and her sister had just returned from a barista competition in California and came back with not only some new tricks she was eager to try out, but a new-found love for her job.  Passion like this is rare, and I firmly believe is the secret ingredient to a successful cup of coffee).

My drink of choice is an americano with an extra shot, some cream and a couple raw sugars. (I know, I know... but hey, I like what I like!) That being said, it's also a risky choice. If the grind isn't right, I can often get stuck with an extra strong cup of undrinkable sludge.  My fears were quickly laid to rest as I took that first wonderful sip... Eureka!  Amazing.  

The only knock I would say is that they have the simple syrup for sweetening instead of granulated raw sugar (which is my preference). But, you know what?  That's the beauty of their shop... they do it their way. And the other thing?  While I was waiting for the bottle of syrup to be refilled, I snuck a sip without sweetener, and quickly realized I didn't need any sugar. It was silky smooth and wonderfully full flavored all on it's own (the way, I imagine, it's supposed to be, right?).  About the time I realized I no longer needed any sugar, she brought out the new bottle... and while feeling bad for making her go through the trouble for me, I passed on the sweetener and enjoyed the cup the way it was: perfect.  (I did pretend to put a couple pumps into the cup so she wouldn't feel like she did that for nothing.)

The atmosphere has a cool urban industrial vibe to it, and it really works.  The only bummer is that it was somewhat hidden and hard to find (nothing that pacing up and down University for a few minutes with my iPhone didn't fix, though).  But like wine is better for the struggle the grapes have to go through in the dry environment, this coffee tastes better because of the sense of adventure in finding it. Okay, now that may be a bit of a stretch, but it was definitely worth the little extra bit of effort to find it.  

I really like the name as well.  We all talk about caffeine as a drug, and the hardcore coffee drinkers (like myself) are addicted and willing to suffer less than ideal cups of "coffee" just to get our fix and avoid the dreaded headaches. So in a way, your barista is like your dealer... and their supplier?  The place they get their "stuff"... a cartel.  Brilliant.

All in all, this is a great joint and I look forward to the next four mornings here in town, because I know where I'm getting my fix...

I really wanted to like this place. It looked like it had a cool vibe from the outside so I decided to stop by and try them out one day. I probably won't come back. 

The vibe is the typical, SF, Seattle hipster hangout. Being from the NW, I've been to quite a few of these types of cafes. Whether or not you're down with the whole vibe, there's one thing in common....good coffee. These guys do not know how to make good coffee. It took close to 10 minutes for the guy to make the coffee for me and it tasted like water. I expected so much more considering when I asked for soy milk in it, the guy looked at me as if I had the never to disturb the natural essence of the brown water he was about to prepare for me. He told me "he'd put it on the side'. Please...this ain't Mastros Steakhouse and I'm not asking you to put A1 steak sauce on a filet mignon. This is coffee, of which you need a little instruction on how to make. Plus..If you're going to act all "hipstery", "Seattle-ly" and try so hard to make and decorate the place like you don't care, then don't locate in Old Town Scottsdale. Also, there was a dirty kid sitting on the table right next to the water dispense having a full on conversation with a barista.. Freaking dirty yo.....

I love your honey latte, but I won't be able to come anymore because you have no parking and I got a $50 parking ticket for going in to have coffee when my meter was 5 minutes over.  Can you work with the City of Phoenix to get parking or meters with credit card swipes?

We came in at a time when they weren't that busy. I checked out separately from my buddy but we both just ordered iced coffee. We stood there awkwardly by the counter for ten minutes before asking the woman behind the counter. She claimed many people had been taking others orders and that must have happened to ours. We were the only people there so we saw everything that was coming and going, none of the drinks were ours. She got our drinks but not even an apology.
One of the best places for good coffe in the valley, if you ask me. Just I find the baristas behaving a bit snobbish, in the Tempe location. Hence, one star less...

I am in town for work and went there for a brunch. Hard to find parking since it's downtown. End up using one of the meters across the street. 
When you walked in, you could hear the loud music, which is kind of weird in the morning. I like the atomsphere and decor. Waitress took my order quickly. I had a latte and the pork hash skillet. Got the latte quickly and it has those pretty pattern on top. It was good but since I am not a coffee drinker, I couldn't tell how good it was. The skillet took about 15 minutes and it came out very oily. Taste is not bad though, but it's a bit heavy with all the oil. 
I think it's a brillant idea that they use the venue for coffee in the morning and a bar in the evening. The setting is definitely great for people to hang out and chill. 
I am just not sure the loud music is a great idea during the day.

I came to this location, as I remember having great experiences with the Tempe location a few years ago.  Unfortunately, the space is very cold and sterile, and my experience was pretty blah.  The coffee itself was great, but the baristas did not seem enthusiastic or happy to be serving.  I remember the Tempe location being lively and with warm staff.  I hope that this location can "beef up" their vibe and be more welcoming to customers that want to enjoy their coffee in a warm environment.  Also, it would be great to offer some food options besides cookies and small croissants.

Coffee is good, but pretty sure I just needed up some ones morning, noticed I grabbed the wrong coffee when I was half way down the block. People that work there are super chill, very relaxed atmosphere. Love it and even though I grabbed the wrong coffee it's still really good
Wow! Loved this place! Great ambience and such friendly staff! great coffee and pastries!

This is a sit-down and take-it-all in place, not unlike coffee shops to be found in places like San Francisco. if you're in a big rush and want things the way you're used to and don't like adventures, please go to Starbucks - there's one right down the street.
Cartel makes each cup one at a time, so you get something truly unique. There are always many different flavors being brought in and switched out, so ask questions and make sure you get something in line with your tastes - unless you like surprises!
Ah good coffee is good for the soul, man!

I have been frequenting Cartel since their opening month. Over the years they have grown substantially and their product only gets better. They take the time to explain their process if you mention that you have never been there. I love trying their ever-revolving door of coffee beans that I then prepare at home. Their toddy is out of this world as well. They recently changed their espresso (again) and this may be their best yet!

I highly recommend this place for any and all coffee lovers.

Oh, and try their tea! It is amazing as well!

felt old, loved the smell of the place.  great artwork on the walls.  good business.  it was hidden behind stores that faced the main street, thanks GPS.  the coffee was great.  and not overpriced.  good coffee places are always something to look for.  this makes the short list.

I really had high hopes for this place. My cousin and I both ordered an iced chai. There was so much milk in it, you could barely taste a hint of the chai. We both thought it tasted like cereal milk. Two sips and we tossed both our drinks. What a waist of almost $9. I might go back and try a regular coffee but until then, 1 star remains.

YES. If you want coffee at the airport this is the place. The baristas are excellent and  customer service is excellent. Cartel has a variety of coffee making methods that include some not seen at any airport coffee stand. You won't be disappointed!

Well....the coffee and pastry was very good....but the baristas need to find a personality.  I don't expect to get hugged or anything, especially being from the Bay Area, but come on man....don't treat me like you're doing me a favor getting me a coffee and then basically ignore me when I want some cancer causing fake sugar.  Maybe I DONT want your honey that you use for sugar....jeez!!

Awesome spot.

Found it randomly after doing some yoga next door and needed a pick me up as I was in total zen mode.

It's a small, but cool and open spot with personality and vibe.

Came here to work as well and it was super chill.

I gave it minus a star because there's nothing out of this world about it, but it's still an awesome spot.
I was just recently introduced to Cartel and I am seriously hooked! The soy chai is the BEST EVER. The atmosphere and employee's are very welcoming and always friendly...cant wait to go back!

I love this little place! Delicious coffee (drink and beans.) One of my 3 favorites (Cartel, Stumptown and Lux).

The times I have had food here, it's been great too. 

I have had nothing but great service. 

My office is moving into this area of town, and I'm very excited I'll be able to walk to Cartel!

Killer Cappuccino.  Not exactly sure why, but think its the beans used(they roast their own),  the coffee/water ratio and the creamy dense topping that I was told is milk, not cream. 

This place takes its coffee seriously.  NYT's had an article few months ago about NYC coffee shops improving their coffee: each cup made to order, no espresso's or capuccino's to go, foamed milk done per cup (vs prefoamed in big container), ideal espresso/cap ratios(no skimping on espresso grinds) etc.  The Cartel's coffees are as good or better than any I used to go to in NYC.

I got a thing for out of this world coffee and "earthy" chicks with a tattoo here and there; therefore, I love the Cartel Coffee Lab. The baristas are phenomenal as well as the vibe and music. The food is surprisingly fresh, yummy and fair priced. There is also a good selection of draft imports. It's a perfect hideaway from the pretentious neighborhood. Wi Fi has never been a problem. It's a 5 star coffee house in my world.

Pretty good coffee and pastries but the service is mediocre and it can take forever because of the way they make their coffee. The place is a little small and they do what they can with what they have but I always feel like I am in someones way when I am waiting for my coffee. Definitely not the place to go for a quick, decently priced coffee. However, if you have time to kill and want to try something new, this is the place for you.
Great location in old town.  Not the most warm welcome, but the coffee was fabulous!  Had the cappucinno and sister had tea.  Tea had the loose leaves.
Amazing mocha and perfect banana bread. I am visiting here again next time I am in town.

In town for a Microwave conference, I was in dire need of a place to escape the hustle and bustle of business, especially after a late night of partying with Yelp friends Shane A. and Sharon M. Someplace with great coffee, good food, and the right atmosphere. Thank God and Baby Jesus that Cartel was just around the corner from the convention center. 

To eat, I had a delicious bowl of breakfast porridge from collocated Kaleidoscope. It was a perfect healthy option considering I ate a business person's special from Pedro's in Glendale last night. I balanced it out with a fancy pop tart from the Cartel counter, and topped it all off with Cartel's world famous cold brew, which could wake the dead. I am now ready for a day of business.

The coffee is fine.  I am very thrown by the fact they don't have any creamer or sugar for taking.   Their poor costumer service skills is the single reason I do nor plan on caffinating here again.  They yell at their customers which is just poor business altogether.

The baristas are always very friendly (as well as trendy). They execute orders promptly and well. I forgot my wallet and learned that this location does not take Apple Pay, however they were very friendly and gave me a drink on the house. (A very good way to keep clientele loyal). It is always a pleasure visiting

Thank you Yelp... I only wish i had six Stars... Ok officially for anyone reading this pretend there are Six Freaking Stars... This place is THAT good!

I thank Yelp because the only way I found this place was searching for 'third wave coffee' (those who know what I mean by this will just know... everyone else will just have to experience and forever after never drink Starbucks again) while I was traveling in Tempe.  

I don't 'like' coffee, I LOVE it (insert Antono Ego voice from Ratatouillie movie here)... I literally have a coffee shrine in my house where I run a vintage Rancilio Z11 and pride myself on my espresso skills.  Simply put, I will never pull a shot like i had here.  Off the chart awesome!  

So that's the first 5 Stars...the Sixth star?? I just can't believe they have GOOD pastry too!  I understand they produce in-house and if that's true then it's completely astounding.  Easily the best croissant I've had outside of Paris.  Run, don't walk to the Coffee Lab; it is worth the flight to Tempe.

I'm torn. The coffee is probably the best I've had anywhere in Phoenix, but the service is possibly the worst I've had anywhere. The dudes are nice, but must be lacking any previous cafe experience. The place is super busy on a Saturday morning, but due mainly to the exceptionally slow service. Lets do some numbers. We walked in at 10am, waited in line until twenty past, and still didn't have a coffee in our hands by 11. Then after much fumbling and confusion, they lost our order twice before informing us that the grinder was broken. We went down the road and had a great coffee from the ice cream shop in no less than five minutes. Perhaps this place really is a lab fronting as a cafe.

Okay, so its probably unfair for me to review cartel.  I went there to pick up beans.  It was pretty clear that the beans I was buying weren't roasted recently.  (They told me they were about to roast.)  But, I was desperate.  In all fairness, the beans smelled awesome. Yet, the taste didn't get close to the smell---not delicate at all---much more grocery store like.  I will go back and try when their beans are fresh.

Atmosphere looked great.  I was more than slightly (ehmmm) insulted when they suggested that I was dropping off my kid for college.  Last I checked, I wasn't nearly of that age group.

Great coffee and great coffee selection!  They always have a few interesting coffee choices in addition to the standard coffeehouse drinks like lattes, you really can't go wrong no matter what you choose.  One day I will get a growler full of their beer, I'm sure it's awesome too!  Service is generally pretty good.

It's a small place with a few tables, nothing too comfy but nice enough.  My only real complaints with this place are: 

They have items for sale all around the same place where you get lids, sugar, etc.. which is annoying if you're trying to get out of there only to try to navigate around someone looking at tea blends.  

It's unclear to people who aren't regulars where to order and where to pick up, this causes unnecessary crowding in the wrong spots and general confusion.  The last time I was in there a guy was waiting at the pickup area so I walked up to place my order, he then called me out stating he actually had been there first but no one told him where to order.  I would have hoped the staff would have said something (like my bad, we should have acknowledged you) but they didn't - I allowed him to order before me but I was mortified nonetheless.

To sum up: awesome coffee, mostly good service, poor set up.

Zero (0) stars if I could!!! Nobody will "experience your coffee" if you are a pretentious asshole. You may "do things differently" but not in a better way. I would rather lick day old burnt coffee grounds out of a Circle K carafe than drink/eat/buy anything you are offering. A local company representing a city in an international airport should know customer service comes first. Shame on you Cartel, you are an embarrassment to my hometown.

Very high quality coffee, well worth the 15 minutes detour we had to take to get here.
Tried a couple of them, my favorite was San Ignacio. Service is a bit slow but the quality of coffee is top notch.
Excellent coffee! Stop by and give it a try at least. Way better than Starbucks!!! The employees are all very nice and willing to share their knowledge as well.

After asking politely, I could not get a "to go" espresso b/c it would change the way it was meant to be enjoyed.  While I completely appreciate a vision and holding to standards, I really just wanted an espresso to go.  You own the product, not the process in which I enjoy something.  You're just not that cool.  Cheers.

Nerd Out on Coffee in this joint, I haven't had a decent espresso since I left home. This place hits every spot, local, hip, excellent beans, Weezer on the background, local art, and baristas that actually give a dam about their craft.

In the past eight years I saw this place truly become the best coffee spot in all of the Phoenix Metropolitan area, I am not even able to find an equal in Austin sadly.  I originally went when it was only one office and eventually was expanded to triple the size.  If you want true coffee, made the right way, with a friendly upbeat/hip atmosphere this is the place. Even though I do not drink I believe the expansion into brewing is a great one as well as having real Teas for relaxing and just hanging out.  If you love coffee, if you love hanging out, if you want to relax, go here.

I love me some Cartel! Checked out this space with a friend on a Saturday afternoon, and was pleasantly surprised to see it wasn't too busy (though still comfortably full!) and that I probably could've brought my laptop here to work for a few hours if I had wanted to.

Coffee was delicious, as always, and service was quick. Perfect location near parking too, which was a plus!

I LOVE Cartel and for awhile now I've been so excited to have a far above average coffee option while traveling into/out of/through Phoenix. 

This would honestly be a 5-star review purely for the coffee alone, but a few times here I've witnessed folks who don't really "get" the upscale coffee scene be blown off or slightly mocked by the employees of this location. It might've been just isolated occasions, but it was still noticed. I think that it's so important to make a customer feel comfortable and welcome in ANY new experience--things like explaining what cold brew is if someone asks or appears confused (rather than "try it, you'll like it" or some such answer), explaining where to pick up coffee after it's ordered when someone appears confused, or even simply calling out customer or drink names after making the coffee, instead of plopping it down and assuming everyone knows what it is/who it is for. 

Anyway, fantastic coffee here, but since it's an airport location I would hope employees become a bit more welcoming and know that their customers will be VERY diverse and not used to a "craft" coffee experience, unlike a typical coffeeshop scene.

Many, it seems, hate this place because it has a "hipster" vibe. But what  if you just like industrial-looking decor? Do we all have to buy colonial furniture now? And if we all do so to avoid looking like hipsters, aren't we just pursuing a variant of hipness? Chill, sports fans. 

Anyway, I liked this place. Jeff is a friendly guy, takes coffee seriously, and there are soft chairs in which I can get some freaking work done. I use a Dell, and the Mac people did not give me the hairy eyeball - maybe because my Dell is so lame, it's hip?

Incredibly competent staff are making superb espressos using a deceptively small La Marzocco machine that produces a lip-smacking, thick-crema quality cup for us espresso addicts.   No more jonesing if you go:  So GO already !

My other favorite coffee shop right up there with LUX. If it's a quality cup of coffee your seeking this is one of the best places in Phoenix. It's tough to say that Cartel may arguably be the best but it depends on how strong you like your drinks really.

The ambience here is great. I have a pretty eclectic music taste but I can't always agree with some of the Barista's as DJ's. Harsh death metal one day wasn't really jiving with me in their low key transcendent environment.

One of the best things about Cartel? The staff. Totally a sweet group of people. The owners are AWESOME folks and super friendly. On top of that the other folks that work there are super swell, approachable, and very friendly.

As with LUX the presentation is always top notch. Make the best of your experience and ensure you request that they make your drink 'for here' and not 'to go'. Also equally impressive is the composting disposal setup. More businesses should follow in suit.
Oh how I will miss this coffee when I go home to California.  Always a perfect latte in taste, temperature and texture.

Two words: loud and expensive 

I ordered a large mocha which ended up costing me $6.25 - the average price of lunch. At least the lunch would have offered me more nutrients and fulfillment than this mocha. It was decent but not good enough to cost that much, definitely tasted better mochas for cheaper. And I wish they turned down the music. If they blast it, at least make it soothing music instead of ecletic music that keeps getting louder and louder.  

Pluses for the large amount of chairs, plugs and quick wifi though!
While in search of espresso, I found this place and it did not disappoint. The people were nice and it seemed like a local place for the University students.

I'm gonna give them 4 stars because for one they make a good espresso & they probably are the best coffee shop in the area, very cozy & laid back. Friendly staff, wifi is fast, I met Reese whiterspoon outside the shop & hung out with her for an hour :) 
Great experience all the way around

Best in the west is all I have to say! I have been coming to Cartel since the early days, seriously the best coffee I have ever had. The atmosphere is solid, I always enjoy the tunes, and love the staff. I love living down the road and can smell the coffee roasting as I drive by.

Update, two years later.  I rarely go there now.  The music is WAY TOO LOUD!!!  And it's not for the customers, but for the employees.  The customers have their own music, but are forced to turn it way up to block out Cartel's music!  They might be able to tune out the sound, but not the pounding of the bass.  Cartel, get a clue.

First visit here was fun. Staff was super friendly and helpful. If you buy whole beans, you get a free coffee. Their beans are packaged with the specifics of the farm from which they came: location and elevation. (Haven't tried mine yet, but the packaging is cool--would make a great gift!). The decaf Americano they made for me was robust and tasty. They also have some pastries-including a gluten-free muffin. They had a lot of these late in the day, do I'm guessing the word isn't out yet and they don't sell too many. If you are near the high C gates, this is your place. But this terminal now has a coffee shop for every pier--so you are never far from coffee. The other two are big chains, so if you have time, you can moving walkway over to this one for a more local experience.

Great coffee, super friendly service, awesome food, what else could you ask for from a coffee shop?
So happy this place is walking distance from my work.
The toddy is a sweet pick me up!

It's about the Integrity of the Coffee?!

Really, you talk down to me (the short little man behind the counter) because putting my Americano in a 16 oz cup will ruin the integrity of the espresso.  This is laughable, rude and downright ridiculous and your coffee, while good, is not the best around.

So I go in and order a 16 oz Americano.  The very friendly young woman behind the counter informs me that they can only make a 12 oz Americano (even though they do have 16 oz cups) and offers to add shots to the 12 oz Americano.  She says that it is about the integrity of the coffee.  I ask, very politely, if they can pour the 12 oz Americano in a 16 oz cup.  Why?  Because, I happen to like milk with my coffee.  The young woman (I would use her name but I do not know it) said she was not sure if she could and conferred with apparently the person in charge - maybe an owner, maybe a manager and definitely what I would consider an unnecessary, condescending coffee snob.  He tells me that they only do a 12 oz American in a 12 oz cup because, apparently, the integrity of the coffee will be ruined if the 12 oz Americano is put in a 16 oz cup.  (Can someone explain to me two things please.  One, when did coffee, wait, excuse me espresso, obtain a personality and gain integrity?  Second, what lab work has been done that has determined that the integrity of espresso changes when poured from a 12 oz cup to a 16 oz cup?)

Then he looks at me, and in probably the most condescending tone I have heard from someone who is trying to run a business in downtown Phoenix say, "Why, do you want to put milk in it?"  As if milk was the mortal enemy of the human race.  I said yes, I did.  He then threw up his hands and with a heavy sigh said to the woman behind the counter, to just do it (twice) and he walked away.   

I paid for the coffee, had milk put into it (btw, they have cream on the counter, along with sugar and fake sugar and simple syrup to put in the coffee).  The coffee is good, though it is bitter.  I can think of 2 or 3 other places where the coffee is better and that will get my business.  

You, Cartel people, run a coffee shop.  You are a service industry trying to make a go of it in downtown Phoenix.  Customers are not always right, but treating customers badly is poor form  Good luck to you and may your espresso always maintain whatever integrity you feel it should have.

If you are stuck downtown for a convention and you want fun breakfast or lunch, great coffee and want out of your hotel this is your place.

Breakfast: Highly recommend the fresh baked scones , and they have lot's of egg dishes. 

Lunch- GF options, sandwiches and salads

Caveat - service is all over the place. Seems they haven't figured out how to correctly staff. Some days my orders were fast, other times were so slow with one girl working the register and coffee counter. 

WIFI- yes

Never again. Overpriced, over hyped, overpopulated, understaffed... I can't believe I was snookered into going there a second time. I should have known, when he ordered the quadruple shot, things were amis.

1. No place to sit, bc everyone else is into being seen there.

2. Long line, very long line.

3. No you can't have the $5 muffin warmed up, bc they don't have a toaster oven.

4. No you can't have a single shot, but it's still going to be a $5 tiny cup of coffee.

The attitude is very not welcoming, bc they're overwhelmed (unorganized and understaffed). Perhaps the cost of the location is the issue. Maybe it's nicer other places.

Best coffee in Phoenix, maybe in the Southwest. First timers, let go of your Starbucks-ruined coffee palette and taste coffee that is roasted with nuance and care. 

It's the difference between boxed wine and a 2010 Oregon Pino. Hold the creamer, sugar and flavoring. You won't be disappointed.

Tried them out after reading about them in an article about the top coffee shops in the U.S.  Was not disappointed. It's a unique environment, very hipster/college student style which isn't really my favorite, but it fits them. I didn't think I liked light roasts until I tried theirs. Really great coffee, great customer service. The barista took the time to teach me about their blends and products and even provided free samples to help me choose. I've returned several times and never left disappointed. I'd highly recommend to any coffee lover.
i can't be more explicit... literally the best tasting coffee beans in the valley. lux is great. village roastery is great... cartel is phenomenal!
Cool, quite place that takes pride in their product. Great coffee, which was what I was looking for but actually had a really good breakfast there as well.

Great cup of Columbian filter coffee.  DittoThai salad and zucchini & goat cheese scone.
Kudos to PHX airport officials for promoting high q locals. 
Great people at cartel- disturbing to see big line at star$... & no line here.
Best airport latte evah! Generally I feel lucky to get Starbucks in an airport so finding next level coffee in Phoenix was a treat. Worth the walk even if you are not flying out of the C gates.

Much friendlier than before and the coffee is bomb. Lots of hipsters. I went there maybe 4 years ago and haven't been back until now due to the incorrigible rudeness from the staff. Things have improved dramatically.
This place is cool. Great coffee and snacks. Great location for being downtown. Always looks and feels very social and enjoyable atmosphere. I'll be returning soon since I work 2 blocks away.
Great coffee and espresso! I also buy my coffee beans from this location for at home. They roast their own coffee and I believe it makes a world of a difference in taste.

The coffee was great, service and food was not. It took the guy for we to make the food which was an English muffin and jam and cold butter in cups. And when I asked how the coffee was made, the guy explaining it was acting as if he was better and smart than me since I didn't know "cool coffee". Bad, support another local business if you want a quick bite and good coffee.

Don't let the hipsters confuse you, if you like a good cup of coffee this is the place to go. It's slightly more acidic than most blends that I've gotten, but it remains to be one of the few cups of coffee I can drink straight without creme or sugar to mask when someone burns their coffee like Starbucks. Going during their rather unknown happy hour gets you the drinks at a cheaper price! Also a great place to just hang out if you go to ASU and you need somewhere to study, I've seen my professors in here grading papers!

Tempe transplant here. Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was PACKED, wall-to-wall with hipsters sitting in oddly straight rows glued to their MacBooks. Some older women gave my husband and I the stink-eye as we walked in since we don't fit that hipster aesthetic. It was loud, but only because the ridiculous volume of the music, as only a few patrons were actually talking to each other.

After waiting in a long, but quick-moving line, we ordered a black tea and an iced mocha. Both were awful. The tea was like straight up water. You seriously could not taste any tea at all. I get it, they are a coffee place, but when you have ten items on your menu, all of them should be exceptional. The iced mocha was a bit better, but nothing to come back for. My husband thought it tasted like refried beans. I couldn't get over the oddly grainy and chalky consistency. 

Overall, don't go here unless you like to sniff your own farts. I'm pretty sure the smug generated from this place was responsible for this year's monsoon season.

Yay! Finding good coffee when you're an out of towner is always hit or miss and sometimes scary. Cartel was a hit. Iced agave latte was delicious. Really laid back atmosphere. Not too expensive either. Just right!

Sorry but if you are going to offer both beer and coffee you need staff it appropriately. You have craft beers and need wait in line to order a beer. Because if you sit at the bar you will be waiting awhile to be served. Ok so you wait in line but because a its craft beers perhaps you would like to taste one or two first. Well you can but you still have that line. So just not practical the way they are staffed.

SERIOUSLY!?!?
this is coffee?
What is the crap I've been drinking all these years?
I've been working in Phoenix for a couple days and can't imagine not having at least one latte a day until I have to leave to go back home.
Nothing is as important as getting into Cartel each day!
Thankfully, I just learned they have a spot at the airport so I can grab one last cup on my way out.
They're a bit spendy compared to your average coffee joint, but you're definitely paying for the quality. Best cup of coffee I've had in the Phoenix Metro Area.

I visited this Cartel with a group of friends one night, just before they closed.  We raced over to Old Town so we could get in the door in time, and I was pleased to see that the lone barista didn't appear disgruntled by our intrusion.  We did make it pretty easy, ordering mostly the same drink (Hot Chai Latte) and paying on one tab.  He went out of his way to help my non-coffee-drinking friend choose a tea and I overheard him joking around as he steamed some milk.  He was friendly and knowledgeable; that's what I want in a barista!

The Chai Lattes are phenomenal.  I don't know what they do differently than any other coffee shop, but they turn out great.  

I like that after weaving through throngs of "Scottsdale people" (you know who I mean) I can walk in to this coffee shop and feel like I'm not in Scottsdale.  It's industrial, small, with cool decor.

I love the iPad that's used for placing orders, charging credit cards, and providing receipts.  It's sleek, eco friendly, and hip.  I hope that's the way of the future!

I also love that this isn't Starbucks.
Awesome hipster coffee hangout spot. On a 100+ day, the Toddy is a definite recommend--iced coffee brewed cold for 24 hours.

I stopped in for a cappuccino and was pretty disappointed.  There were five people sitting in the cafe, and only one order in front of mine, and it took a long time for my drink. It was  lukewarm, and served in a miniscule cup.  And not particularly distinctive in any way, though it looked like the barrista tried to create a cutesy design with the foam.  I'd really just prefer good, hot cappuccino in a reasonable amount of time.

This is for quality coffee drinkers. The prices are higher and the selection more limited, but you won't find better coffee in Tempe. The scones are well made, the cookies are great, and the atmosphere makes it a great place to study if you're a student. It's very popular, so be prepared to wait for your drink.

They actually take the time to educate you if you have a question about coffee. They do this or 4 obvious reasons:
1) they care about coffee
2) they actually like coffee
3) they're kind people
4) they've been trained a lot

They have local spots which are beautiful, if AZ is your final destination check them out!

Ordered a iced mocha with almond milk.. it was way too strong. The coffee tastes great but its overwhelming in the drink I ordered. It also took a while for someone to start taking orders as the line was getting longer and the workers were just standing around.

Cartel coffee is the best brew in the valley, and now you can get it even if you're just passing through! Located in Terminal C this gem is staffed with super friendly folks and serves delicious coffee. On my first visit I was too excited that Cartel was in the airport to decide what I wanted to drink at first. The barista was patient and kind and struck up a conversation while I was deciding. These guys are extremely genuine. Through talking with me the guy realized that a friend of mine had passed through a couple days earlier. Of the hundreds of customers they see a day the staff remembered a specific individual! The service alone is worth the visit but the coffee can't be beat either. Don't miss the opportunity to experience great people and quality coffee next time you're in the airport!

I've been to almost all the locations during my road trip back to Chicago. I appreciate not only the coffee but the ambience. Every location was a bit different but overall a great experience with good staff and work spaces.

Once again I have found myself in the east valley and have sought out the best espresso to be had in this area. Cartel is and probably always will be my favorite stop when I'm in town. The espresso is exceptional and the atmosphere is comfortable.

I'm a fan of their coffee. Sometimes I think they put crack in it because I can be so productive in that environment. The music can sometimes be too loud, but that's why I like to go and sit on the west side of their store where it's much more quiet, but the new seats are very painful to sit on.

There are cons though. Their cappuccino is dry, and difficult to drink sometimes. They only have syrup for sweetener, so it's not how I like to take my coffee. The biggest con I have is their internet. I go here very often, sometimes 2-3 times a week and drop enough money there per week that they should be able to afford and maintain a good quality internet connection. When the internet is down, I can't work. If I can't work then there is no need for me to be there. 

Pro: they know coffee. I like the pallet cleanser with the water that they give you for espressos. Their barista's are ultra hipster, very friendly and I think are hard working. I like all the recycled art they have in the store and enjoy seeing it grow into something for the community.

Very slow food service. Took almost 25 mins to get our food. The food was good but just took too long.

The furniture is incredibly uncomfortable. Ouch!!

I tried them twice while I was in Phoenix. It takes them a long time to make a latte, not sure why as they were not busy both times. The first time my latte was mediocre, the second time it was better. I feel like for $5-6 for a latte, there should be more consistency. There's plenty of seats inside to hang out or get some work done. I liked the industrial look they have going on. We also tried a cherry pop tart pastry which was good but very pricey.

Cartel is a solid coffee shop that can only be described as hipster. It's close proximity to ASU means that it's a popular place for college students to study. Lack of parking (mainly 1 hour parking spots) and uncomfortable seating are probably designed to help motivate people to move on - ha!

They care about quality coffee and I've never had anything there that wasn't well done.

It's been almost a year since I've been back to this location and the only thing that's changed is the staff. The people here now are very kind and easy-going. Coffee was beautiful and delicious. Only took a few minutes to be made. Thanks for a great morning, Cartel!

I came here recently and ordered a coffee and pastry. It took a while for my drink to come out while waiting in an awkwardly cramped space where everyone is always in the way of each other..  

Also, don't let the display of pastries fool you! They all look delicious, but I am almost always disappointed. This time, my pastry was dry and pretty bland. Not to mention, my coffee was piping hot! Like too hot..

Atmosphere is nice but always so so crowded. Chances of finding somewhere to sit are like 1 out of 100000. And don't expect it to be a quick stop either, unless you have a least 10 minutes to spare. Parking..well don't get your hopes up
The people that work here are friendly. The coffee is seriously great but the portions are a little small. I got a caffe macchiato and it was amazing!
The employees of this place love their coffee. I was surprised to find a place like this in Arizona but they are on point! The space is clean and nice and the coffees taste great.

I recently moved to the area from CA and this is definitely my favorite coffee shop.  The coffee is a super leaded gas machine that will wake you up ready to conquer the world!  I love coming here to work on my computer, the atmostphere is diverse, down to earth, amazing music, rounding it out with a warm modern aesthetics that is very inviting.  Two thumbs up to the baristas for your hard work yet always keeping a friendly smile.  I highly recommend visiting this coffeeshop when your in the area.
We are from Seattle and this place rocks! Fresh roasted beans-cool atmosphere! Phoenix may finally be getting away from the mega strip mall coffee!
Prime are nice, prices are decent, espresso was good and cold brew is better than some places. Would recommend to try, and i may be back, but it wasn't my favorite coffee place

God bless my Tempe Tour Guide. Wise beyond her years, leading my lost soul to caffeinated salvation.

BACKGROUND
---------------------
One fine Sunday afternoon, as my Southwest flight made its descent into Sky Harbor, Eba Cafe suddenly popped into my head. Why, I don't know.

But Boba. 

I had to have it. 

As I stepped into my dusty car sitting in the Gecko parking lot, I made a quick call to Tempe for some tapioca companionship, and I was well on my way.

But as luck would have it, Eba's closed on Sunday. Seeing the dejection  seared across my face, my Tempe Tour Guide suggested that we should take a walk. Outdoors. In the neighborhood. Because people do that sometimes. 

And so we strolled and enjoyed the cool breeze, noticing quirky 100 year-old houses and hastily discarded CRT monitors, before finding ourselves at the entrance of one Cartel Coffee Lab.

THE SETTING
-------------------
Very unassuming from the outside, Cartel is a dimly-lit world of wonder indoors.

Industrial garage-type setting with art all over the walls,  plus tables, couches and hipster college kids tapping away on a mishmash of Apple-branded products. A roaster with bags of beans for sale in the back, and the Clover coffee machine to the side. Music is as is assumed: Death Cab and various Pandora-mates. 

My Guide is all in the know about Cartel, but declares me a newbie and the barista kindly asks me if I want to hear The Shpeal. I say "sure" and she talks about how Cartel is about quality product and the mastery of roasting and brewing the best espresso and coffee. A few of the Cartel baristas had gone on to win the Southwest Regional Barista Championships, but instead of resting on their laurels, they're constantly looking to excel in what they do. She also highlighted the Clover machine which brews a single cup of coffee at a time for maximum quality.

I was pretty impressed by The Shpeal, I will admit. But now it was time to judge the actual product.

THE PRODUCT
----------------------
So, as one who sadly became averse a few years ago to having real cappuccinos unless I planned on staying near a bathroom for the rest of the day, I've gotten used to drinking a lot of black coffee. And as Starbucks probably makes the worst drip coffee known to man, I was looking forward to trying the Clover machine's output. But then the barista threw me a curve ball.

"You know, it's hot outside. Do you want to try our Espresso Excelente? It's iced! And it's pretty damn tasty."

"Uh, what is it?"

"Espresso, combined with our own horchata, cream, and a dash of cinnamon."

"I'm not a big froufy coffee-drink person, and I was looking forward to just a plain cup of coffee, but now you've made me curious. And it is hot outside. Except I have this lactose thing, so I guess I can't have it. Doh."

"Doh yourself. We have soy cream we can use instead."

"Sold!"

VERDICT
--------------
Incredible. And not just because Cartel has Business Continuity Plans for people with lame digestive tracts. Whoever came up with the horchata-espresso idea is a genius. All the flavors in my cup were perfectly balanced, and there was absolutely no bitterness in the espresso. This barista knew what she was doing, delivering me one of the best espresso drinks I've had in a really long time.

And my Guide, standing beside me, looks at me and smiles in a Zen sort of way. Omnipotent, and serene. I told you she was wise.

FIVE STARS, MR. K?
---------------------------------
Eba what? Who gives a flying hootenanny about tapioca. Cartel is where it's at, because my drink was that excellent.

Which causes a conundrum, obviously, because I may have to re-rank every other coffeehouse in town accordingly. These guys are leagues ahead. 

However, to be fair, I'll probably update this review on future trips when I  try three more of my regular drinks:

* a plain cup of coffee
* an Americano
* a soy latte (probably the hardest drink for any coffeehouse to do really well)

Given how serious they take their craft, though, I'm sure each will be exceptional.

I also give props to zero attitude from the staff. They definitely have the potential to be all about their own uber-barista glory, and silently tell non-hip looking customers like me to stuff it, but they're far from it.

SYNOPSIS
---------------
Cartel Coffee Lab = Perfect independent free WiFi Tempe coffeehouse. Strongly recommended for coffee purists who enjoy true quality drinks . No run of the mill Starbucks crap here. And as the weather continues to heat up, I have a feeling the iced Espresso Excelente is going to be pretty damn popular.

Also, my Tempe Tour Guide is full of wise and awesome.

-fin-

This place is perfect for a strong cup of coffee.  The staff is friendly, outgoing and stylish.  I come here on a weekly basis with my wife, we usually get an iced americano and a cold brew.  The baristas usually pull good shots and nearly every experience is an excellent one.  The corporate lobby is mid century modern, sharing with other businesses in the building.  I wish they had their own seating, but I understand because of the location.
Dirty Chai? Why yes please. Great location and great people working and the iced coffee is refreshing on a hot day. They even make affogatos.

To follow up again: 

I went back some time ago and they still failed to correctly pull a shot of espresso. 

I also left a direct message for them, a private message that should have been a "retain a customer" slam-dunk, but they didn't get back to me. 

They're just not interested in correcting training/mechanical issues nor responding to consumers who reach out. I deserve better, and in this town I can get it at any number of shops within a few-mile radius.

I'm giving one star only because it was suppose to stay open till 10pm but when we got there 9:20pm the door was locked and the guy working there totally ignored us and other customers trying to get in.  I thought how ironic as the door has a sign that says yelp love us and it was indicating that it was still open.

We had a business meeting here and pretty much took over the place.  It was early in the morning and there was still room for the other customers.  We got yummy eggs and muffins, and probably the bet cup of vanilla latte that I've ever had.  If I lived in the area, this would be a regular haunt for me.
Ordered a Chai coffee. It was the best coffee I ever had, but it was too sweet. Went again and asked them for half syrup. That then became the best coffee I ever had.

The coffee is prime here. I always get a Soya Dirty Chai Tea Latte and they're always super quick and friendly. Their homemade goodies are delicious and the ambiance of the place is supreme. Good chill music, you can enjoy the sounds of coffee beans being roasted aside you, and they have their cute Cartel Brewery next-door.

Cool third wave coffee shop in downtown PHX. Small, but shares the seating area with other businesses in the same building, interesting setup. I got the El Bosque (Chemex) and it was one of the most unique I've had. Appeared like it would be weak but it wasn't, didn't have all of the overpowering bitter notes of a lot of coffees so whatever their Chemex method is, it's a good one.

Just go and have the best coffee in town and shut up about hipsters, uncomfortable chairs, not enough wall outlets, and the fact that they market specialty coffee. That is why they don't want to put flavoring in your coffee. They take pride in the unadulterated product. If coffee isn't your thing, go to Dutch Bros.

This was the perfect place for a mid-morning pick me up.  I was feeling sluggish while waiting for my flight. Cartel Coffee Lab came to my rescue! Try their iced coffee...it is a delicious treat that packs a jolt.
I haven't been to this location, but I loved it! I had their vanilla latte and it was just so delicious! I will be back again!

Coffee is really good. They have a handful of brews. Cappuccino is a little more like a latte but tastes awesome. Comfortable seating, seating with tables and bar seating. 
We walked up just as 4 or 5 other people were ordering and it was a little chaotic but nothing that would detract me from coming back...just kept me from giving 5 stars.

Sitting at one end of the motel(?)-converted-strip-mall adjacent to Buffalo Exchange, finally found Cartel.  Ironically I heard a rave about it from Jeff M last year, and I'm glad I didn't have a chance to read his recent review.  I'm your typical social coffee drinker, so maybe I would of felt undeserving to grace the doors based on the flack, but my gal pal and I got no attitude what-so-ever.  

In fact the blond barista definitely knew her drinks and graciously explained away.  I didn't have to worry about an order faux pas with my iced mocha, but my friend definitely didn't get any flack when she hoped for a caramel macchiato offering.  Once advised it's not a la Starbucks style, she was gently steered into an agave-flavored ice latte.  Besides both drinks being awesome, I agree w/ Jeff -- it IS about service -- and this barista hit it right on.

Grabbed a quick non fat iced latte from Cartel before boarding my flight - fast friendly service! If I'm in this terminal again, I'll surely pay them another visit and perhaps try out a new drink. Good stuff!

I've heard of the lore of Cartel Coffee from my brother, a good friend and several other people but since I never drank coffee until a couple months ago, I had no reason to step foot in one of their labs and see for myself. 

Well when it came time to drop of my girlfriends mom at the airport and we had an hour to kill, I thought coffee is good, but where..... well the Yelp app came though again and pointed me here. 

I had that moment of nervousness walking up since I'm trying to impress my girlfriends mom and not take her to a crappy coffee place, and this place does not look like much from the outside! I felt relived and overjoyed walking in and seeing how awesome it looked. My "guests" were equally as impressed. 

After getting our coffee we chilled on the couch talking and time passed so fast we were almost late, but luckily the airport is only 10 minutes away so it was all gravy! 

Since I don't normally drink coffee I won't be here often, but when I do, I will prefer to go to Cartel.
Cool little shop in a very nondescript strip mall.  Cool people, drinking cool coffee.  Best iced latte I've ever had!
Best place in town to get coffee. The atmosphere is so perfect. The manager Dustin is amazing as well.

Coffee is super strong, just how I like it. There's a very cool college vibe here, as well as urban art. Came here with my mom and we really liked it! If fake Starbucks coffee isn't your thing, come here! You'll be impressed!

Let's talk about Cartel Coffee Lab in Scottsdale. Let's!!

This place makes all of my coffee nerd/ trendy hipster senses tingle with glee. When you first walk in you'll notice there's art on the wall, and long couches, long tables. I actually love the furniture in here. There's a little indoor/outdoor hallway on the side that has a comfy couch and tables, one of which has a chess board, if you know how to play (which I don't). 

Then the coffee stuff. This is what I love the most. They have all brewing methods. French press, chemex, aeropress, you name it. Not to mention a manual espresso machine and hand poured latte art. GAH! 
The two guys working today are perfection. They are fun, friendly and efficient. Not to mention they make a killer latte. Yum. :) 
Also, I had a blueberry muffin that made my tummy very very happy. 

I love Cartel Coffee Lab. I will come back again and again.

I usually meet my friend at cartel for coffee. It is definitely a cute little spot in old town. Their coffee is really great also! They make pretty foam leaves on their lattes! I haven't tried their pastry, but they look sooo good! Next time I'll have to try it out! I'll be coming here again sometime soon!

I Love this place.
I almost go there every day. 
My favorite drink at Cartel: Hot Agave Latte'

Literally the best coffee I have ever had. They have wi-fi but tell you up front that they dislike "internet squatters" so you kind of feel pressured to purchase more throughout the day if you stay there several hours. Dislike that. The level of hipsterness can be quite nauseating but you can get past that as long as you sip your delicious coffee and just stare at your computer screen.
Love love love this place!! They make the best hot vanilla latte! They make it to perfection every time. Wish there was one in Gilbert. I'd go every day.
Just wanted a decent decaf as plain and simple as that. All they had in a decaf was Americano. Received it lukewarm and blah. Tasted like burnt beans. $5 down the drain.

"Best Coffee I have ever had." This was the remark from a friend whom I took to Cartel for the first time today.

The place has attitude and is willing to call a customer out. Something I would love to do more than I can. If you want Caramel, or Vanilla, or a Milk Shake, or a Burrito, or Cotton Candy you need to go somewhere else. This is a Coffee shop.

They roast their own beans so they are fresh and tasty.

Simply the best coffee I have ever had in an airport. Worth the wait. 

Note to fussy baristas--cold brewed coffee isn't always served cold. Sometimes places add hot water or milk.

this coffee is so good that you probably shouldn't ever go here. 

"but why," you ask. "that makes no sense," you proclaim. 

listen, if everyone starts going here and then i have to wait in a line next time i stop by i'm going to be a little disgruntled. the last time i was here it was totally low key and peaceful and i got to enjoy my coffee and small talk with the owner without being rushed. what a gem.. especially for me coming from los angeles. 

so please.. stay away from Cartel. for me.
Ordered black tea.  It was old and going bad.  Bought a fruit cup and received the core of the pineapple.  I know it is airport food but this is supposed to be Phoenix's finest.

Incredible coffee, on the same level as LUX coffee bar and perfect for people closer to the Tempe area. Go to LUX for the atmosphere and cartel for the coffee and make sure and try the Iced Toddy it was incredible!

lets just say that I didn't particularly care for coffee til I had Cartel!! Just a great clean flavor! mmmm...my favorites are the Iced Toddy, Espresso Excelente (which is double shot with homemade horchata) and the cappuccino!  
There are only 2 coffee's I drink in this town, and Cartel is one, the other is secret!

Since moving to their new location, (just a few doors down from their old stomping grounds), the atmosphere in this once friendly neighborhood coffee shop has really changed.

The homey, artistic feel has been replaced with a cold concrete and metal vibe which the aloof, hipster staff seem to mirror.

The coffee however, is still some of the best in Phoenix and although I have yet to try any of the menu items from the new kitchen, I'm sure they are superb.

Hopefully the new Cartel will figure out how to breathe some life back into the concrete world they have created before alienating too many of their loyal customers.
Great atmosphere and amazing coffee!! I highly recommend their Chai. Best Chai in town hands down!
Best espresso in Phoenix and best espresso within an airport. Watch out Portland!

If you're stuck at the airport this is a great spot to hang out. Great coffee even the coffee snob will enjoy. Trendy feel to it which is a great change of pace from most airport spots. If you're in Phoenix try their other location.

I was feeling a bit slumpy on a Sunday afternoon. And as a California native who recently moved out here, I'm definitely still acclimating to the bone-dry Arizona climate. The heat really taxes me, especially when I'm already in a mental fog.

Anywayzies, I was perusing the streets of downtown Scottsdale with a friend was visiting for the holiday weekend. We both needed a pick-me-up and a task to kill a bit of time, so we decided to hunt down a caffeinated solution. Starbucks is great, but there are a ton of great alternative coffee spots in Arizona. Luckily, my Yelp search results fed me Cartel and I'm pleased to announce that I have found a new go-to coffeehouse. 

My order: an iced vanilla latte with 4 shots. Wow! There is definitely something extraordinarily invigorating about the coffee beans Cartel harnesses. With every sip, I gradually regained pep. The next thing I knew, I was bopping and singing along to a Spotify track in my friend's car. 

That said, I don't recommend 4 shots if you're already kind of awake. I think next time I'll level down to 2 shots if I'm already primed from some sort of caffeine intake earlier that day.

I also have to say that atmosphere-wise, the charm and comfort level of this place is incredible. With plenty of space, as well as couches, chairs and tables spread out amongst 2 rooms, this abode is an ideal spot for hosting a wide variety of scenarios; from a dynamic conversation between friends, to a great first-time meeting spot for a Tindr rendezvous, to a study haven for a last-minute cramming session.
Glad to have found this site.  My son took me there once and I couldn't remember where it was.  He is in Seoul and wants me to bring him back some Cartel coffee in July!

This might be the only place in the airport where the workers care about what they do and want to be there.

Can't say that about any other coffee place in the airport.

Ok, so 2nd time I've visited Cartel Coffee Lab. First time around at Scottsdale location was a good experience, and happened to be in this neighborhood needing an afternoon cup o' joe so thus my stop at this locale. The place was bustling with what seemed to be happy customers which included locals, ASU students and business peeps. 
Staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. I made a selection from the current brews and went with JauJa. I was happy with my choice but for some reason it did have a slightly burnt aftertaste. Possibly beans roasted too long? I will probably give them another try but if that's how they roast their beans all the time this may not be my first go to coffee shop. I do like that they have a "secret" taproom in the back where they brew several beers. Will have to come back to try that out also. It was busy as well though it was barely afternoon.

I can't believe I haven't yelped about the place yet. Several months (maybe over a year?) ago my husband read a newspaper article about the Clover coffee maker and the one place in town that had managed to procure one. I was skeptical (as is my nature). It can't be that much better right? You're just saying it's amazing because you want to talk about the new hot coffee shop you discovered, right? Well, maybe. But I love this place. And I don't think it has a whole lot to do with the Clover. They roast their own beans and they roast them way differently than that other ginormous coffee chain - all a light or medium roast. Never bitter, never oily, never yucky. The coffee they make there is, obviously, the best. But I send my husband in every week now to buy a pound of beans so that I can approximate the same coffee at home. Add an edgy (though sometimes intimidating) seating area, great local art (which we bought off the wall), and smiley service...I'm sold. Can't wait to try out the downtown location.
Very nice selection of gourmet coffee. For the coffee snobs. No garbage syrups added here. Educate yourself on coffee, then give this place a review. Highly recommended!

As a barista, I'm super picky about my coffee. I love trying out local coffee shops, and Cartel is my current favorite. They have a strong selection of blonde roasts, but no dark roasts here, unfortunately. They also have a few local beers which are entertaining to try as well.

I like both the Tempe and Scottsdale locations, but I tend to frequent the Scottsdale shop slightly more often. It's pretty quiet, and serves as a nice location to do homework, read, or produce music.
Kind of a dark and moody vibe/atmosphere if you're into that. The espresso is smooth and dark, definitely nicer than Starbucks.

Am I the only person who finds this place just OK? I mean, having gone to ASU I know a ton of people who were raving about it for years. I finally came in and was sort of disappointed. 

First good thing: coffee quality was good! Nothing amazing, but definitely met my expectations. Also, the people working there were super nice! 

I was actually turned off by the decor. I am not a taxidermy fan at all, and they have a bunch of stag heads on the wall near the kitchen that are the main focus of the coffee shop. The random, red chandelier made no sense. It's like they're just trying TOO hard to achieve something PHX hipsters will like! That's basically the best way I could describe it. 

I had coffee cake and we sat and waited a good 10 minutes before we were brought anything. My coffee cake was lackluster, to be honest. Tasted like something I could get at Safeway and was a little bit stale. 

Also, if you're main selling point for your brews is iced coffee: don't run out of straws. I wore a nice, white shirt and couldn't enjoy my coffee because I was I concerned drinking it meant spilling it all down the front of my blouse. 

TLDR: hipsters trying too hard, but the coffee tastes fine. Won't be coming back.

I found this place on yelp the other day when i was on a mission to find a place that does those cute little designs on top of their drinks.. haha lame i know. But I came across cartel coffee lab and had to check it out because of the stellar reviews!
