When I was ordering, I said I wanted a drink with the coolest design and the cashier kindly explained to me that although the designs are cool, that cartels main focus and goal is really on the taste of their coffee and how its made etc.. she recommended a cappuccino for me.

Of course I received a lovely design on my drink, but she was right about the taste! It was so delicious. I've really only had starbucks coffee and the occasional dutch bros, but this place is really exceptional. Best coffee EVER.

I swear I'd be here every day for my coffee fix if they had a drive thru!! lol :)

Great coffee, cool vibe, awesome people the only con is we can't take their cappuccino to go. I understand it would taste so much more exquisite to have it in house. But if you have great coffee it shouldn't matter.

A hot spot for the local hipster community. Coffee is delicious, yes! But staff is not very nice, sometimes they are pretty rude and pretentious. it is very cold due to poor control of A/C temperature, it is generally dark-no windows and dark walls. And the art exhibit there... well, not my style at all.
But still, if you are looking for a nice and local coffeeshop in downtown Tempe, this is the only decent option.

They have great tea options with regular options then fun unique ones. The bakery section is limited but each option is delicious. My only complaint is that I was meeting someone there and the location was intermittently loud. It was like each song had its own set volume and was annoying.
Back in PHX again and making a detour for some of the best coffee brewed. Thanks to the crew at Cartel.

We didn't try anything here but beware, the pictures of food posted to the yelp photos for this place are for another location. They don't serve acai bowls or protein bowls or breakfast burritos here. Just coffee and pastries and some prepackaged salads in a fridge.

This place is great. Excellent coffee, delicious salad, awesome decor, friendly baristas, and all for ~$17 with a tip . I ordered a latte and the eat the rainbow salad (veg). The baristas also had great taste in music (they were playing Halsey's entire album). I will definitely come here again when I fly through Phoenix.

This was a pleasant surprise during my last trip to PHX. The staff was knowledgable and when I ordered an iced coffee I was happy to discover they cold-brew it there (the true champion's way) and they don't try to mellow it out with sugary syrup like ****bucks does. Not only that, we had a discussion on the merits of various cold-brew devices. A+++++ would drink again.

I don't give 5 stars often but for those of you who see my Check-in's via Yelp, you know this place is my coffee go-to! 

5 reasons YOU should get your coffee on at Cartel:
1- Its local. Support your local business and PAHLEASE stop drinking corporate crap.
2- They take their coffee seriously. Have you seen the way they cold drip coffee? or how they delicately stir lattes? Yeah, get to it.
3- The vibe. LOVE the artsy interior and the fact they promote local artists by displaying their work through out the shop.
4- They have two central locations for your coffee addiction convenience. One in Tempe on University and Ash. The other on 5th avenue in Scottsdale. 
5- They both offer delicious pastries and the Scottsdale location has breakfast and lunch options and just recently expanded their counter space to offer scrumptious beers.

It certainly doesn't hurt that the staff knows their stuff about coffee and that their service is courteous and real. If you don't enjoy your espresso here, you're only hurting yourself.

I love you Cartel!

I love the atmosphere in Cartel Coffee Lab. Great interior design, modern/industrial, colorful, great music, hipster for sure and lots of tables for the college kids and their laptops. Lets face it, if you are a coffee joint close to a university, you better have free wifi with a drink purchase and lots of space for college kids to sit and bust out their laptop. Thank you Cartel for doing it right.

I have only been here twice but both times the service was friendly and the drink time was good. My first visit I ordered an iced americano and it was divine. The second time I wanted a soy latte but they were out of soy. Turns out they had been out of soy for two weeks or so. I said I would try the almond milk and boy.. was that a bad decision. The almond milk just isn't good in a latte. If they aren't carrying soy anymore I will stick to iced toddy's and americano's.

This coffee joint is better than many! Check it out.

Cool atmosphere but I'm not sure I know what's so "lab" about it.  You will pay for that cup of java!  Their largest size in cold drinks is 16oz and 20z for hot drinks.  More and more independent coffee houses are getting away from any size north of 20oz for some odd reason.  A touristy location in the 5th avenue shopping area.

This is the best coffee that I have ever had. It's actually out of my way, but I have gone home "the (super) long way" because the flavor is like NONE other!. Hands down the best coffee that I have ever had. I also like to buy their bagged coffee for home use. 

I am not a "tree hugger," but I appreciate how responsible they are with regards to the environment. 

The decor is all its own and I love that.

One of my hobbies is finding fun coffee shops that inspire me to work and create. 

Even before I moved to Arizona, I knew about Cartel from friends. Cartel's whole brand is "that trendy and hip coffee shop you go to when you want to feel cool." It's a place that makes you feel mildly impressed/pleased when someone new in your life suggests meeting there. (I've screened potential roommates there and it's probably a fine place for a casual coffee-date.)

I will say that this "air" creates some hype, a bit of it unwarranted. Being so close to a huge university probably necessitated the scale of the Tempe location. Its hugeness kind of undermines the comfortable feel I personally look for in coffee shops. Sometimes there are just **too many people!!!** and I feel like I'm in Grand Central Station. There are more baristas on staff than your typical coffee shop, and not all of them are 100% pleasant. But their latte art is impressive.

The art on the walls, if I'm not mistaken, seems to change quite minimally. It'd be so cool to see more art from more local artists getting showcased, as it's clear there's a lot of foot-traffic coming into the shop. 

Finally: the coffee. I'm not going to lie and say I'm an expert on coffee. It's maybe my top 3 in terms of cold brew? Pretty good, but not out-of-this-world. Super quick to grab and go (5 mins tops), if you're in a hurry. 

I've had fun trying the different espresso drinks, at least one of which I hadn't heard of before. I enjoy them better than the cold brew. I actually insist on sitting down to have them so I can enjoy them slowly. 

But yeah, overall it does the job it sets out to do. Also, if you're a fan of tiny spoons, you're gonna love it here.

It's ok. Nice ambiance, just not my ambiance. I am trying to focus and be inspired where I am and what coffee I drink. The Cappuccino fell short, I couldn't even finish it. It's a shame though, because it was a beautiful cappuccino just not tasty. Moving on to the next coffee shop.

Place was packed on a Sunday at 5PM. Barista used two scales as he made my latte, one for the grinds and one for the espresso. Was quite good, and I'd definitely come back for coffee if I lived in the area (visiting from North Carolina). 

Unique space, great coffee, abundant seating and lively student/scenester crowd. I see why this is a popular place and well reviewed. Wasn't here when the roaster was going, but I imagine that it generates an awesome aroma which would wake one up very quickly on a cool morning. 

My only criticism would be that the staff had let the garbage can next to the lids fill up to the point where garbage was beginning to accumulate on the floor, and the restroom trash can could barely be seen beneath the mountain of paper towels; people had begun to just toss them in the general location of where the bin was, and they'd roll off onto the floor.
I was looking for a dark roast coffee and they said they didn't have any. I got a pretty good Americano while waiting for my flight. I would definitely try again!

I really enjoyed this place! I tried their iced latte which was very yummy. My sister got the iced chai latte which was also good. It reminds me of a hipster coffee shop in Los Angeles, CA called Intelligentsia. I love the fact that they have coffee and beer- pretty cool. I'll definitely be coming back here and introducing the place to my friends.

So glad to see independent businesses expand into airports instead of letting food service hell take over.  I first found Cartel Coffee Lab in Old Town Scottsdale and loved their coffee. It is very, very good. Even if I have a tight connection at Sky Harbor, I make time to grab coffee at Cartel.

The coffee here was good, but I'm not sure a $5 plain latte the size of a shot glass is worth it. I finished it before I finished walking away! Sad to say I should've gone to Starbucks. 2 stars for good service and decent flavor.

I like the coffee, but this venue is lacking. I would recommend the downtown location. There is a certain 1990s-mixed cassette-hackysackness smell that doesn't quite mix with the high quality coffee they brew.

Where students sit and tries to do homework while being visible on the social arena. It caters to the hipster vibe with wickedly strange skinny males in "humorous t-shirts" and scrawny beards waiting on you with content. Sure, I am NOT your clientele base. I don't play the game, and I know what phase of life you're going through -  now shut-it, and fetch me a tasty beverage.. please?! 

The idea to serve craft beer and quality coffee under the same roof is not original, but genius nonetheless. The ambiance is anachronistic, yet modern with a soupÃ§on of retro. I enjoy balancing on the edge of my comfort zone.

The environment is also ambivalent for both a meeting of a more or less intimate sort, as well as a private moment and yet cater to the modern ostentation of narcissism of the younger crowd. (Yes, I am dating myself AND distantiate myself from a younger hipper crowd of which I have nothing but jealous content for.)

You CAN come here and treat it as a cafe while being glared at with implied antipathy - which is cool. 
You CAN come here and treat it as a bar in a sense while being catered to as a outcast - also cool.
You CAN probably come here and define this place as you see fit - it might go over well. 

In either way, I will be coming back until I figure this place out.. and if not, there is beer to taste and coffee to drink. Win-win right? Plus, they are open in the evenings... this alone is star-worthy.
I adore their pour over selection and their cold brew is to die for. There is ample space to relax and enjoy your coffee. Favorite unwind after work.

Dear Cartel,

What happened between us? We used to be on the same page: good coffee, a nice vibe, convenient. But now... I just feel like you're trying so hard to be cool or whatever. 

Today you gave me scalding hot tea in a mason jar and a tiny vintage tea cup. I know you thought you were being clever and off-beat but did you know how difficult it is to hold/carry/pour a glass that is hotter than the boiling pits of hell? The tea went everywhere. The tiny cup only held half the remaining tea. It was just so unnecessarily hipster, Cartel. 

Look, I know you mean well but I think it's time we took a break. I'll always remember when you were just a tiny coffee shop tucked into a strip mall.

Goodbye.

hands-down the best coffee in the Greater Phoenix area.

Passionate baristas that know their products. A commitment to quality. A great space for getting things done. I plugged in the headphones and spent a solid 5 hours here one afternoon. Had a great conversation as I was visiting from another shop in Columbus, Ohio.... This is my top recommendation in all of PHX.

I couldn't believe how great this location was.  Having been to a few of the Cartel locations in other places in the city as well as having their espresso as guest coffees at other cafes around the country, I never imagined I would get a great shot at an airport, no matter what the brand name on the sign. But boy oh boy was I wrong.  This place had great service, an innovative customer service set up, and fantastic baristas that performed as well as their other locations.  I couldn't have been more surprised.  This was an absolutely fantastic thing to have in an airport, and it makes me want to connect through Phoenix on Southwest (they are in the southwest terminal) if i absolutely HAVE to connect.

A hidden gem.

I very much like this place and from a 3rd wave coffee lover's perspective, this is well worth a visit. 

I love Cartel.  Every time i make it to Arizona, I come here.  The coffee is amazing, the staff know what is up, and the decor/feel is nice.
The coffee is really good. Cool to see them roasting it there. They also have beer on tap.

Great little coffee joint in the Phoenix Airport.. it's deep in the C 10s terminal. Coffee tastes like coffee and the baristas or coffee mixologists, what's the proper term these days, were really friendly. The atmosphere is urban with a splash of hipster. Great coffee, glad we found this hidden gem.

I MISS YOU CARTEL COFFEE!
You were my go to for coffee while at work at the airport every day. Your coffee is wonderfully delicious. Smooth,  never burnt, or over heated,  never to strong.Just close to a perfect cup of coffee. I Wish you guys were here! 
Not only was your coffee good your staff was attentive and never hoovering. On many occasions their would be friendly chatter and laughter. At this airport location at least when I went there their was  always  at least one vegan muffin or bakery item. Which on occasion I would get. But I mostly went there for the oh so delicious coffee. 
Thank you Cartel Coffee Lab, you are the best.

My previous review was for Cartels old location. On the corner of Washington and 1st Street. And I've been told (because I haven't been back since they moved to their new address) that seating at the new location is much more limited then the former. 
All I can say is I wish they didn't have to move the old Cartel location was really nice. 
But I'm glad they are still close by and serving their good coffee. Please Cartel keep on keeping on with the great coffee. You'll keep making all of us smile as we enjoy your great coffee.

What?!? There is a Cartel Coffee downtown?! How did I miss this for so long???!! 

I only "discovered" this location while aimlessly wandering around on my lunch break a few weeks and have been back weekly since!  The staff here is great and friendly. And, as one of them told me, they treat coffee like more of a science here.  They know their stuff and are always sure to highlight some of the tasting and flavor notes within a particular blend.

Their toddys are the best I've had and their pastries are divine! And to make it even better, their baked goodies are all half off starting at 1:30 in the afternoon - which happens to perfectly match my lunch hour.
I also look for a good independent coffee shop. This one was very good, wonderful soy cortado. Will definitely come back here when in the area!

Why 5 stars? Because this is the best coffee you'll ever find at an airport.

   ---   ---   ---

Of every airport I've ever been to, I've never found a coffee spot as awesome as this. You really don't feel like you're inside an airport while you're waiting on your beverage of choice. I think it might be an optical illusion, and not actually inside the walls of Sky Harbor.

Not only are the drinks delicious, but the trendy decor is as hip as it gets. And while service can vary hour by hour, the barista who happened to help me was incredibly friendly.

There aren't a ton of details one can procure from a four minute experience, but Cartel was as good as it gets across the board: taste, service, and ambiance = 3 thumbs up!
Terribly slow...especially when it needs to be at a fast pace in the airport terminal. Also, the coffee is not good...tasted very weak and burnt!  Where's Starbucks when you need one??!!
Rude and discourteous employees. No horchata latte. Bummer waste of time. Phoenix and Tempe Cartels are completely different.

Amenamy - Purity Ring (Jon Hopkins remix)
CHVRCHES - Mother
Blackmill - Let It Be

Any place with a playlist like this and repurposed anything in this city merits attention. I don't really find a lot of places in Scottsdale that parallel my mood that often, but this cafÃ© brings a touch of Alfred's/Intelli/BlueBottle to the area. Maybe even Philz since this is one of the few places with azn kids in the desert.

Coffee-wise, pretty comparable and yummy. Almond milk latte, dirty chais are yummy. The crowd is mixed and interesting. Favorite chill spot in the area, although it makes me emo hearing a track every 15 minutes from a band that I can't see live here. At least we got Jamie XX.

Visited the other day after hearing about it.. Waited about 15 min for my pour over. now understanding the time needed to make the drink it still took way too long and still rated average as far as quality, and taste which explains there expansion plans just another corporate company sacrificing quality for money...

Unfortunately as of late the service has really gone down hill. I still think the coffee is great, when you can get it. If they are busy then they seem to really get the joe out, but if they aren't things slow to a crawl.  Not to mention they have messed up my order or my friend's order the last four times we have been there.  They apologize or say thanks for being patient although I never understand why we had to wait.  They seem to have enough staff maybe it's how they manage the preparation.  I had stopped ordering espresso drinks all together and just  get the cold brew since it comes out of the dispenser at the counter.  It's really a shame it used to be my favorite spot for coffee.

Beets Peets by a margin

Kills. Starbucks

Great cremora ( sp)?

My new favorite wakeup brew in phx.  

Thanks for the wakeup juice.
The best coffee at Phoenix Sky Harbor.  Take the extra moment to walk to C11-C19 in Term4 and get a Chemex or pour over.  A bonus is to support local!!!

I've been going to this Cartel location for about 8 years, when it was just one part of its size now. Love how they've expanded the menu and have monthly featured drinks and new flavors. The coffee roasters really know their stuff.

The staff is less than friendly for sure. Once you step inside it feels like you're an inconvenience to those who work there. If you're rude to them, then getting rudeness back may be expected. But just asking for coffee shouldn't get you a healthy dose of attitude back. Looks like this is something that others have written about and is the only consistent thing here besides solid cold brew. Doesn't look like it's ever going to change. If you like great coffee and being judged at the same time then this place is for you. If not, head to the Old Town Scottsdale location.

If I lived here, I would dehydrate here.

Cool place, yes, hipster central but a gen x person could slip through if sufficiently slovenly.  Great brew- and that is two fold, I started with a hot coffee and read the paper while seated in a cozy couch.  Then I moved into the beer room, and had a flight undoing all the learning I did whilst reading in the coffee room.  Two vices- caffeine and beer- always a winning combo.  Great beer by the way, friendly service.  You can chill here for a while or warm up with a good cup of suds or java. Why not!

I love when local businesses are able to set up shop in the airport and get their brand and product exposed to a wider audience. Cartel Coffee Lab roasts their own beans and sources from around the world. Their menu is fairly basic, if you want frou-frou drinks, they have flavored syrups on hand, but you'll have to ask for them. Their cold brew is out of this world, one of the smoothest I've tasted and hella strong. 

I guess you have to get here early for their pastries, because at 9AM they were either all out for the day or they somehow weren't out yet. There's a small seating area to drink your beverage and charge your device. 

The only downside? They only do espresso drinks in ceramic cups for "dine-in" service at the bar. I was in a rush, so that wasn't an option. But if you find yourself at PDX with time to spare, spend it here.

Cartel has come to be my absolute favorite coffee shop. This location in particular is my favorite because it is far less crowded than the Tempe location and is open later than the downtown location. The ambience is far less hipster than the other cartels as well, but maybe that's just because it's in old town. Other pluses include the stocked pastry selection, clean restrooms and cool outdoor patio.

No dark roast. "Trendy" staff. Baristas openly male bashing. The squeaky, valley girl tone of voice ran me out. To boot, the coffee wasn't good at all. In fact, a bit sour. Overpriced of course. The cashier was nice.

- I was there March 16th.
 
     This coffee shop is AMAZING, i love the vibe, the artwork, their freshness, and of course their cookies!!
     I have already been raving to my friends how good this place is, and how we need to frequent coffee shops like this kind more often, instead of our usual Starbucks.

     The service is outstanding, as I walked to the counter I was greeted by the cashier and I bluntly told him that it was my first time there and that I was taking their Chai as well as a pastry, but I didn't know which one. He then started telling me that their pastries are freshly baked each morning at their downtown location, and that he suggested the Chocolate Chip cookie as it was his own Fav!! So I told him, You had me at freshly baked, I'll take your chocolate chip coffee and a Medium non-fat Chai. The only thing was that they didn't have medium sized drinks, they only have small or large, small is just too little for me and large is just too much, medium is just perfect for me, but no medium and I end up not drinking it all. So I took the large and as expected, I wasted about 1/6 of my deliciously large hot  foamy non-fat Chai!!! :)

    I will surely be back to frequent this spot, everyone there was oh soo friendly!! :)
Best iced vanilla macchiato Great service and helpful staff. I would definitely come back to this coffee shop.

A top notch coffee shop in an airport!!

They know how to brew a quality pour over.  Four types of single origin coffee to choose from.  Good knowledge and excellent customer service. Not over priced or pretentious.  

Nice to have a Starbucks alternative.

Whenever I am in PHX I enjoy a cappuccino at Cartel. Great coffee!!! I love that you can get coffee in a real cup here. It is a small space but you can plop down and crowd watch. They also have some latte art skills.

For all the things that the PHX airport doesn't have (style, walk-ability, comfort, etc), it always surprises me with little gems like this hidden down it's brown, dark and depressing corridors. 

Cartel offers an alternative to Starbucks in a friendly and comforting package. Prices are about the same but the taste of the drink is just different enough to make you think you have found a whole new gold mine just waiting for the picking.

Next time you are awaiting your Southwest flight, make sure you visit Cartel for a refreshing beverage. All of this can be had before fighting with your fellow air travelers over spot A45.

Came here because I heard they roast their own coffee. There's several tables set up and in the middle a couch for more of a ''lounge'' experience. The espresso/americano (for a small $2ish) I ordered was really yummy. I don't drink straight black coffee or straight espresso but wanted to try it to see if i could tell the difference. It definitely was smooth and tasty. But I had to add a little sugar after a couple of sips.

The place itself is sorta of a grungy-atmosphere  but most people here are young/hip customers. The staff are young too.

This is a good place to chill/meet friends and just internet surf, but the music was a bit too loud for my taste if you're going to study here. 

Not a lot of parking space but overall a great place if you want to avoid the starbucks/chain ambience.
Outstanding coffee. Obviously coffee geeks like myself. Worth the walk past Starsucks. Made my morning. Thx guys

I do not like it. Period. It looks old, pretentious and dark. The coffee....meh... it is ok, but not so perfect.... The place is kinda old, or looks  old and I cannot understand why people think this is a perfect place to study....
These guys were awesome!  Super low key and knew their coffee! We are in from out of town and this place was a great treat!

The espresso is good, don't get me wrong. However, the service is not for everyone especially not for commuters at the airport in the morning. They take a good 30 minutes for a latte and they treat you like dog crap if you ask them for updates on your drink. It's not worth it unless your delayed And you have time to spare.

Okay, here's how bad it is...My husband and I went to Cartel in December/January ONCE during a visit to AZ for the holidays and nine months later (today), I saw an art website that mentioned exhibiting in the Cartel Coffee Lab...and not really one to remember places like coffee shops, this was one we couldn't forget!   It was the kind of place we wish we had in our neighborhood.  The coffee is amazing, it's smooth, rich, and delicious.  Yes, they're a bit noisy, yes, they're fussy about what they serve but that can be a good thing, right?  Especially if the standards are high.  And, yes, it's hard to find.  But, yes! they have wireless.

When I visited AZ, this was the place I always went to. The people in there are all amazing. The coffee isn't bad and there's always a ton of people. There's plenty of new people to meet if you're a person who likes to socialize!
a fave. phenomenal coffee... stellar atmosphere.

Trying. Way. Too. Hard.

I love my coffee and I love it most when it's within the small business community but here's where this wannabe hipster place went wrong:

1. Not enough choices for a person who knows and loves their coffee.

2. The actual coffee (wherever they say it was imported from) actually tastes like watered down mud with sprinkles of attic dust.

3. For serving sewage waste in a cup, they have the audacity to really ask a lot in price.

If you're in the area, you're better off taking a small drive down to LUX Central to get yourself something you actually might like or something at least worth paying for.
The pumpkin bread is very good and they're coffee is great! The barista was super nice and helpful. I'm a fan.

The coffee was just alright. The service was lame at best. The two people on shift kept talking to what I assume is another coworker who just stopped by to chat. I was the only customer and I guess I was an interruption. Going to McDonalds would be better then this place.

After going around Old Scottsdale, my dad and I were craving some coffee and ended up finding this place. It was a breath of fresh air after always going to the usual Starbucks. I like Starbucks, but the coffee here has a unique taste to it...even my 6 year old sister loved the coffee here! The ambience of the place is very chill. It's very much "hipster" and "artsy". There are abstract paintings everywhere, and unique pieces of furniture. When I went there, there were many people studying and going on their computers. 

I ordered an Agave flavored Iced Latte which was the best! If you're a black coffee drinker like me, this place is amazing. The latte was flavored so it had a bit of sweetness in it, but not too much. Most of the ingredients are organic, so the coffee tasted very refreshing. I think the agave flavoring is what made the drink so unique. I have to go back to get it again, and maybe bring my laptop to relax there.

delicious! everything was great... very friendly and helpful staff   the iced dark chocolate  mocha was strong and flavorful my pretty and bold cappuccino woke me right up because I was dying lol!  we also ordered the  pop tart it was very light and airy and not sure what the other one was but it was bomb! soft and chewy  definitely  coming back to try the beer!

This place only gets better - nice to have all the extra room since they expanded and it still maintains that funky urban vibe with interesting furniture - we sat on cardboard chairs - and the best Cappucinos in the Valley!
Great little coffee spot in downtown Scottsdale.  Cappucinos here are the best in the Valley - reminds me of being in Italy.  Great scones and muffins too and a relaxing place to get some work done.

I went to the Scottsdale location of Cartel
before I came here. This place is the best. It's a massive space, filled with all kinds of seating depending on your needs. On the right hand side is where they roast their coffee, so it smells great as soon as you walk in there. I met the head roaster when I was there, he was a really nice guy and is super knowledgeable when it comes to his craft. 

What a great way to start the day! I ordered a pour over Wahana coffee, after the barista described it as the flavor of peppers without the kick, along with a coconut scone. The scone was perfectly crumbly, not too sweet, with just the right amount of richness from the coconut. The coffee was amazing, unlike anything I'd ever had. It actually did taste like peppers, in a good way. The coffee was savory and earthy. 

I wish I lived in the Phoenix area because I love this place.

Cartel Coffee lab is a really great spot for some really good coffee, made how you want it. It doesn't end there, though. There's beer and wine and a selection of baked goods. I went there on a tuesday afternoon and it was packed. It's especially perfect if you need to grab a coffee after getting some Original Chopshop Co. for lunch.

I only got the classic drip coffee when I came because I realized, a little too late, about all of their coffee selection. They have different roasts and beans and can make it in the aeropress or three other types of pour-overs, including the chemex. 

Cartel knows their coffee. Their service was great too.

Cartel has been my go-to coffee location for the past two years; ever since I moved here from the east coast.  I've yet to be disappointed from any of my experiences.  The baristas are truly passionate about what they do, and are always friendly and helpful.  The coffee is amazing.  I regularly go for an Aeropressed Ethiopian, but have tried their espresso, latte, pour-over, teas, and cold brew.  It's all great.  If you want to run in a grab a quick cup of drip, they have that too.  I've been to nearly all third wave coffee shops in the valley, and Cartel is by far the best.

A must whenever you are passing through terminal 4.

I have always made a point of stopping in at this coffee company whenever I go through Phoenix international.  Approaching the staff can be a little intimidating if you're not a coffee snob, but don't that sway you. They are very friendly and willing to explain all their different types of coffee.  For the picky coffee consumers:  They sustainably source all their coffee, and do nearly every brewing method.  

Bottom line: Always a solid cup of coffee. 

Disclaimer - They do not make the insane sugary coffee things like frappes or white chocolate mochas.

Nice little local coffee shop right downtown in OldTown Scottsdale.  Easy to get to and park in the weekday morning since all the other shops haven't closed yet.  Friendly staff and decent prices.  Nice local atmosphere.  Agree with Roxy H. that it has that feel of the Aussie local coffee shops. For stay-in coffee they have mugs with a refill pricing that is nice.
Some of the best hand dripped coffee I've had since Philz in San Jose!

So can I just say the peach pop tart I ordered from here is AMAZING!? 
The coffee was decent as well! I order a Gomez which happens to be my last name, coincidence, I think not. But it was a tad strong so just keep that in mind when ordering! I also got my mom a dirty chai which was really tasty! My friend order an iced latte, if I remember correctly, which she accidentally spilled on the counter because of faulty lids but the barista was so nice she cleaned up the mess and made my friend another one and didn't fuss about it. Their service was good and I would definitely go back to try different pastries and coffees!

Coming off my fifth 12-hour overnight shift in a row, all I wanted was to crawl into my warm bed and play coma patient for a few days. But the amazing Ashley S. somehow snagged us tickets for the Justin Timberlake/Jay-Z concert in LA, so sleep would have to wait! Bleary-eyed, I somehow made it through security and stumbled onto Cartel Coffee Lab in the Southwest terminal next to gate C13. The lime green countertop, smiling baristas, and aroma of freshly roasted coffee beans perked me up right away. My iced vanilla latte ($5.25) was incredibly smooth, rich and not too sweet, just the way I like it. The prices are pretty comparable to Starbucks, but I'd gladly pay an extra dollar or two for a better blend. Starbucks coffee always tastes a little burnt to me, and they typically overdo it on the syrups. 

Other than Cartel, you might want to check out the airport locations for other favorite local haunts, including Le Grande Orange (to-die-for sourdough english muffins) and Cowboy Ciao (OMG that chopped salad). Kudos to Phoenix Sky Harbor for supporting the local establishments! :)
one of the cutest coffee shops i've been to. the staff is so warm and friendly! i ordered a soy latte. the foam was really chunky and just wrong. but after scooping that out it tasted really great.

When you walk into the small door from outside your world is transformed into coffee heaven. Although I always grab a cold one on the way out, it's always nice to get some frothy espresso and enjoy a game of scrabble sometimes.

A great spot to grab a coffee off campus and to steal some time for yourself. Secretly hidden, The best way to start a hot day is with an ice cold Toddy (extremely strong iced coffee) it's got an acquired taste but it'll have you up and running in no time. Cartel's Coffee is very strong. First time I ordered a shot of espresso I even had to chase it down, definitely worth a try!!

Their addition of the Ipad in the ordering process has helped speed up order time & looks pretty cool too. So, if your in a rush grab one for on the go & if you've got some time sit down for the day. Either way, one step into  Cartel Coffee Lab awakens you. My favorite coffee joint in Tempe for sure and perfectly hidden from the close noise of ASU's Tempe campus.

really give it 3.5 stars.

to qualify myself, i'm not a fanatic but i refuse to drink bad coffee. i'd rather go for a red bull if i'm that desperate for caffeine. so while i'm no expert, i guess i'm a snob.

coffee was very good, but not mind-blowingly orgasmic per most of these reviews.

in town for work. always like to find a good alternative to S.bucks when i can. this definitely qualifies.

had an Americano. very bold and pretty smooth. came in around 10a during on a weekday. moderately crowded, but pretty good set-up for working.

wi-fi was totally fine. 

so overall the coffee was good and the place/people were fine and totally unremarkable. not sure what the fuss is about either way.

Not my favorite coffee,
I have had coffee all over the world.
And have never had something taste so acidic, and burnt.
It's hard to screw up a latte or even a mocha, yet both times they have not been right. 
Barrista's are too busy chatting and texting to acknowledge  the  customers.
Extremely hyped up for sour and bitter tasting coffee 
I shall not make it a third time .
Usally 3 strikes and your out, sadly not this time 2 times was enough, 
Plenty of other places to go for better coffee and much friendlier Barrista's.

An excellent change of pace from your normal Starbucks in the airport. The cost is A little higher than most coffee shops in the airport it it seems to be a bit more upscale. 

I just got an americano and it was great.

Need a wake up call...this is a good spot to get your fix. 

Also have several delicious pastry options.

Definitely hipster... trendy.... good lattes?  Hell yeah!!

Walked in today and ordered a hot small (still a double shot) latte with half&half... the first sip really blew me away!  Can't say I've had one this good since this little cafe in Cordoba, Spain.

The gal at the register was friendly and helped me pick between half&half and soymilk.. 

I liked their simple syrup pump... didn't like that they had no cinnamon/nutmeg shakers because I love that in my lattes.. but glad I didn't pervert what is to be (so far) the best US latte I've ever had.  Damn, I wish I lived closer.

Place was hard to find and, yeah, no prices... and if you're not a hipster, you really do get noticed and stand out.

So very Portlandia in its hipsterness and decor. Premium coffee roasted in-house, in the middle of the desert, no less! Who would have thunk it.

Baristas were profesh and friendly. They even warmed up our pastries upon request. Perfectly foamed milk and fruity noted espresso. I hope this place has a long life in Scottsdale, where great coffee is few and far between.

I am a major fan of your coffee. Enough said on this. 

I am less of a fan of your customer service- I would rather a smile from the cashier instead of some ironic stare.... but it's a pass.

I am requesting that you bring back non-sweet/sugar-filled baked goods. Such as croissants or toast. 

Some of us (the public) can't have sugar. Others of us choose not to ingest sugar filled muffins, cakes, and scones with our coffee. Please stock your store with an alternative that is not a packaged granola bar.

That is my feedback. 

Again- You do coffee well! Maybe I'll be forced to get a snack elsewhere.

Cartel has great products and I've never been disappointed with any of their drinks. However, it may take a half hour to get it. I know they are completely different from a place like Starbucks, but when there's 5 or 6 people in line at Cartel, it will absolutely take 20 minutes to get your drink, which is absurd and ridiculous. A place like Sbux would take 5 minutes. Let's give Cartel the benefit of the doubt with their solo machine and manual tamping. Even if you triple the time, you're still waiting longer at Cartel. Never go there if you are in a hurry. If my drink was ready just minutes after I order it, I'd be giving them 5 stars. Since they ALWAYS take forever, they get 3, it's that tough. Their drinks are delicious and I'm sad I don't go there often but it's not worth a 20 minute wait.

- - Rudest Service ever
+ Good Coffee


I swung by for a cappuccino during a short work break. I work in the area and read the great reviews. I got some of the most over-the-top unjustifiably RUDE service experience at a coffee shop I've ever had. I walked in, waited in line, ordered just a cappuccino, left a tip and, waited at the bar for the woman to finish making my cappuccino. She poured it into a ceramic mug -- and she did a really beautiful pour that looked great. 

"Oh, could I actually get that to go?" I asked with a Midwestern twang.
"No, we don't do cappuccinos to go. We do lattes to go" she retorted.
...a short pause....
"Oh, ok, well, could you just pour it in a cup" I said trying to figure out how I can drink my coffee without gulping it down quick so I can get back to work. 
"No, we don't do that because of standards and stuff" she retorted.
... another short pause as I stood flabbergasted...
"I can get a cup for you and you can pour it in yourself" she interjected, mustering a few shreds of customer service.

Look, I get it, you want to maintain your hipster cred. You did a beautiful pour and re-pouring it in a paper cup will wreak that. I'm not a picky jerk of a customer, I tip, I'm not even mad about pouring my own drink in a cup: I'm mad because you could have at least been nice about it by saying something like "Oh, we usually don't do that, I can grab a cup for you, but next time I recommend you order a latte". I've been a regular at small independent coffee shops my whole life and have never encountered someone so un-willing to pour a cappuccino in a to-go cup. I think I'll rather go to... Starbucks... over this place. I hate Starbucks but at least they don't treat customers like complete trash for no reason.

I travel a ton, and try to find unique local coffee shops wherever I'm at. I've had Cartel at PHX airport and think they have great coffee, so I figured I'd give this location a try.

Bottom line: Great vibe, great coffee, great service. I'll definitely be back!

This place is awesome.  I don't like coffee very much, but I LOVED their mocha.  When we arrived there was a piano player and a guitar player jamming out, plus there was great outdoor seating if you wanted to get away from that.  It was so much fun.

Very good! loved my iced mocha and Chorizo burrito! just a bad combo. lol
I will be comic back here very soon! only complaint was costumer service...

Every time I go to the coffee shop I try their cold brew and theirs is so smooth and full of flavor! And I love how they have simple syrup and cream at the bar to allow you to customize your drink to your palette. The atmosphere in here is great for meeting with friends, studying, or just a place to rest and have a good cup of coffee! You can even see them roasting their beans inside and if you don't know what to order the staff is super friendly and explains everything to you.
Really nice and cozy environment with friendly staff and great house music. Sat here awhile to stay out of the heat. Oh yeah, a great Cup of Joe too!

I am so happy I found this place.   Best coffee shop ever hands down!! I had a mocha and it was so creamy and delightful.  They even made a foam heart on top.   My only disappointment was that they were closed when I arrived back in Phx.  I am definitely going to one of their other locations soon!

I was here tonight for the first time and loved it! The ambiance is so much better than the Tempe location (which I love too). The tea I got was amazing, the staff were friendly, and they serve alcohol too. Will definitely be back to this lovely spot!

This place suffers from an identity crisis. Is it a coffee house, lounge, restaurant, bakery, bike shop, etc.?   Didn't care for this place at all. The coffee was bitter. Walking in for the first time, I couldn't tell how this place functioned. Do you order at the counter or tables? Where is the cream and sweetener for the coffee? In fact, what is that in the unlabeled bottle? Oh, liquid sugar you say after I have to ask. Label it why don't you?!! I asks for cream because the cream container was empty, the worker says ok and continues to drink her coffee. I had to asks another worker for cream. He tells me it's in the empty container. Pretty bad customer service for a $5 cup of bitter coffee.  The food is terrible. Eggs that look like rocks and under-cooked potatoes! When I ordered hash browns, the worker says they don't have hash browns, only potatoes! Last time I checked, hash browns are potatoes!

Coffee done right can instantly change my mood.  The last few times, they haven't disappointed. They took the time to describe what pour over and aeropress beans were available and offer suggestions. Good coffee and good people.

This is the pinnacle of quality coffee in AZ. Cartel introduced me to the complexity of flavors in those coffee beans and taught me coffee shouldn't have an over-roasted, stale, and scorched flavor. Ever since that first cup of Santa Julia I've been hooked! (hope the Santa Julia comes back -_-) My favorite coffee now though is the Atitlan. 

They roast coffee in house and brew your coffee by the cup. They brew with the aeropress, v60, chemex and clever depending on how much coffee you want. You should definitely purchase whole bean and be brewing their beans at home too! If espresso is your thing, they also do that really well. I'm not really an espresso guy but there's is very good. Also, lattes and cappuccinos are amazing. Perfect balance of milk and espresso. That goes for the mocha too, the chocolate makes the drink sweet without overpowering the espresso.

As far as ambiance goes, it's a bit loud. They have the music louder than most coffee shops so if you need peace and quiet than this may not be the place for you. I still manage to get work done here all the time but it's not the most peaceful environment. If you're here to socialize, however, Cartel is your place! Cartel also makes their own beer now and brews tea as well. I'm not very experienced with craft beer though so I will let you judge how good theirs are. I've had one green tea here and it was delicious. I'm not very knowledgable about tea either so I'll leave that to you guys.

I've tried a bunch of places around Scottsdale because that's where I live and they all fall short. Press Coffee in Scottsdale makes great coffee equally as good. But their lattes and cappuccinos are...the same drink. It frustrates me to have a cappuccino that has way too much milk in it. Tastes like I'm drinking steamed whole milk...actually. Altitude Coffee Lab is a brand new coffee shop in Scottsdale and also makes great fresh coffee and roasts in house. The problem is that they don't brew by the cup. I can find places that come close to Cartel, but they all fall short! Cartel needs a North Scottsdale location.

Anyway, if you're on the fence about it, get your butt down to Cartel and have some delicious coffee! No one does it better!

The best coffee Arizona has to offer!

Cartel Coffee Lab does it all. They send their roaster down to South/Central America to source great coffee, they roast coffee themselves in Tempe, AZ and they brew the coffee in a way that respects the chemistry of the bean and ensures the resulting cup is of the highest quality. Other AZ cafes come close, often offering great cups of coffee, but none are as involved in the process from farm to cup as Cartel is! Trust me, you, the customer, are the beneficiary of all their crazy coffee worship.

Cartel also has several cafes that all have their own unique personality. This 5th Ave location in Old Town is one of the friendliest, most welcoming and relaxing of their cafes. Great place to get work done and the baristas seem to cater to the crowd in setting the ambiance. If everyone's in with friends getting (alcoholic) beverages then the music will be turned up a bit and more upbeat, if everyone's got their laptops out or their nose buried in a book the music will be a bit more calm. 

My favorite drinks are any of their hand-brewed coffees, the cappuccino, the cortado and the one-and-one (ask your barista!).

Oh, and I could rant for an hour about why complaints about price are irrational but i'll keep it short. Coffee is an agricultural product that requires an ENORMOUS amount of work to grow and process. If you take a second to think about where your coffee comes from and all the hands that work to bring it to you, you'll wonder why each cup doesn't cost $10 and each bag doesn't cost $50!

$4 for a black coffee -and I even brought my own mug?! That's robbery. Had I known I would have gotten a cappuccino as it's the same price but much more labor intensive. I don't understand this pricing scheme at all.

This place is very nice with nice seating options. I like the workstation tables when you can study, or simply work on your laptop or tablet. The coffee tastes very good and fresh. 

The only problem is the wifi. It didn't work for me on neither my laptop, nor my smart phone.  I even tried a tablet but didn't work neither.  I asked the guys working there, someone told me he would check on that but never got back to me neither did the Internet work. 

I would've given this place 5 stars of the Internet worked.

No hands down, the best espresso in the greater Phoenix area. Talented and passionate baristas (albeit strange sometimes), simple and direct menu, and no bullshit. In-house roasted coffee beans at the most premium quality. Almost always perfect cappuccinos (in house only, the way it should be), locally brewed Chai from Tucson, and organic/fair trade ingredients. A must for real coffee-lovers.
Located downtown and a few minutes away from our hotel. I ordered the soy latte and it was good. Service was friendly and they were helpful when I asked for options for those lactose intolerant.

Single shot of expresso -fucking crazy.  Soo good and strong.  Nothing Starbucks about the flavor.  Explaining the tier system in regards to the sale of pounds of coffee was sort of confusing.  But, I bet the coffee is worth it  judging by the expresso I had.  

I'm not hungry anymore.

Looooove this place! 
Great atmosphere. AMAZING cold brew... and I drink it black. 
Suuuch a cool place to meet up and do homework!
The people are awesome. Very helpful and not "barista snobs" like other worth while coffee places. 

A heads up: the parking directly adjacent to the cafe is STRICT one hour parking. And there's a very diligent little parking man who stalks you like a hawk to time you. Be warned.

Had to leave without picking up my coffee after their slow as hell barista took 10+ minutes to make 4 drinks.  My flight was early boarding so I asked for an ETA and he gave this "I'll get to it when I get to it" attitude.  

The girl at the counter was flippant as well. I don't care if the person at the counter can't spell my name, but after I tell you how it's spelled letter for letter, get it right.  *My name is a very common one so misspelling it proves your an idiot.*

I'm always trying to support smaller businesses, but screw this place, I won't be going back.

Starbucks might be a large chain but at least their baristas and front counter people act like they give a rats ass about their jobs.
Ride your bike here and relax. The wifi is a bit spotty and a little slow, they make up for it with great service and amazing coffee.

I've lived in some very coffee-centric places in the world (SF, LA, Boston, overseas) and this is a good place to grab some espresso in Scottsdale. The baristas are super friendly and funny, a nice change from the exceedingly pretentious coffee-slingers of San Francisco and Los Angeles. Decor is a nice blend of retro and modern, music can be a bit deafening.
Always great people, service, and beverages at Cartel! (Wish their chairs were more comfortable... these are hard, steel little things!). ;)

Solid service, great atmosphere, great coffee!

Highly recommended if you want to kick back and catch up with a friend, get some work done, or looking for a low key date spot.

Well.. once again I trusted you dang Yelpers and once again you've proven yourselves worthy of that trust.  I'm sitting here in Cartel now just loving the smell of roasting coffee, the ambience, the music and one heckava cup of joe..I'll be back...my kinda place..

Some of the best tasting salads and sandwiches in downtown Phoenix.  Freshest ingredients and completely original flavor combinations.  Baked goods also offer something special, that home made flavor and texture.  There is always an array of hearty cookie choices to choose from.  Nice informal atmosphere, mix of students and office workers.  A little sidewalk seating if you're so inclined.  Others have already raved about the drinks so I don't need to here.  If you are interested in supporting locally owned businesses that are offering something special, go here.  It is surprising how many downtown regulars do not know of this little gem when you mention it, but that will change based on Cartel's great offerings.

Pretty noisy here which was a challenge for my casual coffee meeting. Lots of people on laptops and a pretty hip environment near the university. The cold brew was above average but would have liked to have gotten a better description of their cold brew options as their cashier didn't seem very knowledgeable about their offerings since I'm don't do cold brew that often. Maybe next time will a different experience.
Great coffee and a new joint on the corner now. A light bitter coffee but it definitely beats Starbucks, hands down.

They put a lot of love into their coffee making! Hands down the best coffee! I came here and enjoyed the chai and mocha lattes each day I was in Scottsdale. I will miss my morning pick me up and friendly service now that I am back home.

Pissy customer service followed by the worst cold brew coffee I've ever had. 

Never wanted a refund more. 

Of course it's airport so travelers always get the worst at the highest prices.

The coffee is full and rewarding. Yet, I can make just as good. When I frequent a coffee shop I demand service. The two times I frequented (I use that term loosely because I will not frequent again)  at Cartel, I was served arrogance and conceit.

If the biggest coffee geek on the planet had a basement to himself, this is what he would create -- a lab, indeed. The coffee experts can get their rocks off on all the high tech brewing equipment, and the single-origin coffee, and food pairings, and what have you. 

On the other hand, the dilettantes and casual coffee enjoyers can get an excellent brew, without too much condescension. Yes, you will get a cocked eyebrow and a gentle suggestion that you pass on the cream, or other additives. 

But there is no sneering, and you will get your accoutrements if you ask for them. And you will have to ask, since they are stashed out of sight.

All is all, it's a cozy little lab to get your coffee geek on, no matter what end of the spectrum you hail from.

This business recently changed names from Sola Coffee Bar to Cartel Coffee Lab. I loved it before, so now with the expanded hours and menu, I expect it will be just as good or better!

Before changing names, I heard Sola already brewed with Cartel's beans, so today when I tried the coffee, I wasn't surprised that it tasted about the same: not overly strong, but delicious.
cool atmosphere. delicious strong lattes!
My main complaint before was lack of seating, but with the recent expansion even that small issue has been fixed. I love this place!

Cartel is a little hidden gem! I never knew exactly where it was but since I've gone my BF and I are hooked! Defiantly a place to check if you're a big coffee drinker! Parking is limited however I'm usually always able to snag a spot! Lots of tables and spots available to bring your computer and do work! The only down side is the coffee options are a bit limited however, they have the staples and you're drink will always be legit ( they weigh out the beans etc).

This is truly a hidden gem in the valley. It looks like a small little shop from the outside but when you enter you're greeted by the amazing smell of coffee and much much more room then you couldve ever imagined. The coffee itself is amazing and the staff is awesome. I'll never go to Starbucks again!

The best chai you'll ever have. The drinks are always great and the staff is friendly. Only four stars because I dirty chai will run you 8 bucks and sometimes you wait upwards of 10 Minutes for your drink. I keep going back because this place make quality coffee drinks

5 star coffee/service help and knowledge, 4 star ambiance, 2 star food.

As I understand, the "cool" coffee shop scene and options are lacking in Phoenix relative to my home in Denver. But this place has it. They take their coffee seriously and understand it well. Barista was friendly, helpful, and informative. The coffee was excellent (had the Puerto Verte). All are medium to light roasted. The slower speed of service seemed to be a product of brewing to order. 

The breakfast sandwich was good but pricey for what you got. It also had meat in the egg patty (which was not advertised on the menu). And NO condiments (salt, pepper, ketchup, hot sauce, etc). WTF?

This coffee snob is WAY impressed. 
Delicious brew. Nice presentation. Staff was informed about the business, which is great for an airport location.

I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars. I liked the vibe of this place and feel like I could definitely get some work done here. This place is pretty big for a coffee shop, and there's a lot of seating. I had a cold brew coffee which was fine. It wasn't bad, and it wasn't delicious. The girl who took my order was fine too. She wasn't overly friendly or helpful, but she wasn't rude. My main issues are with the condiments bar and the bathrooms. I went to doctor up my coffee, and the milk was in one place and everything else in another. The cream was just sitting at the bar where you pick up your coffee in random unmarked containers. You have to ask what's what, and it's just kind of a chaotic mess that seems like a temporary solution. Then if you want a lid, straw or stirrer for your cream or any sugar it's hidden around the corner. They didn't have many options for sugar, and again this area was cluttered. Finally got everything I needed and sat down and then I had to go looking for the wifi password. I went to the restroom a little later, and it was just scary in there. Eww. I feel like this place thinks since it's dark in there, it doesn't have to be clean. I think they need a giant makeover. Coffee shops can be independent and trendy without looking like a dingy basement.

Since I had some poor customer service experiences at Cartel, they've really made an effort to improve. There is still some snark, but I haven't seen any rudeness in a long time. They're making a definite effort to educate or work with customers.

Their coffee has always been top notch, and if they continue to develop the service side of the equation they are going to be solidly one of the best coffee shops in town.

I have been traveling to the Phoenix area somewhat regularly (for both family and business visits) for about 15 years.  The coffee I found there never failed to disappoint, until..... I  visited your Old Town Scottsdale shop this past weekend.  Wow!  Finally there is really good coffee in Arizona!  Your shop is great, and the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable.  Your espresso is right up there with the best in Seattle, Portland, and San Francisco.  Congratulations and thank you!
Iced coffee Americana was awful. Almost $5 and after a few sips I tossed it. This is second bad experience at cartel. Last time it was the mocha coffee. I miss Starbucks.

Ive been coming here since they were just local roasters who wanted to make some drinks on the side. The coffee is excellent, they will occasionally throw out your drink and make it again if the expresso looks off. The staff is helpful, thoroughly competent but a bit snobby, as hipsters tend to be. Who cares, this is the best coffee in phoenix!

I'm so happy this location exists! I am a die-hard fan of Cartel's black market espresso for my home machine, and it's easy to get my fix here since we find ourselves in old town on a regular basis.

We buy 3 bags at a time since they comp our drinks with the purchase. I always get a toddy to go, and I love the simple syrup pump they have out because I can quickly sweeten my drink.  

The staff is pretty nice and polite, no attitudes detected here. One server even took the time to explain different techniques to make iced coffee when I asked about some of their equipment.

The coffee itself is my absolute favorite. It's smooth while still providing a good caffeine kick. It has comletely ruined us. It's not cheap, but I justify the splurge since my morning cappuccinos are what gets me out of bed in the morning.
Always perfect... friendly staff that makes you wanna hang around and chat. Wish they had some outside seating for this time of year.
Amazing coffee, but they closed their espresso machine a half hour before closing. So unprofessional. Unreal. Never go here.

I have been to every coffee place in Scottsdale, I am not exaggerating - Literally every one. I only ever get straight black coffee. Cartel has the best. Places like Sip use Cartel Coffee but for whatever reason I like it best at Cartel. If you want the best coffee in town go to Cartel. However,  Cartel lacks friendly staff.

I am a very easy going person, not a lot of things bother me, and really the employees do not bother me all that much, but enough to write this review. I have had this conversation with many different people, and we have all agreed - the Scottsdale Cartel employees are aloof and dismissive. I am not sure if this comes from management? I know Abercrombie used to tell its employees to act aloof, so to add to its brand culture. I know that Cartel offers a premium product in terms of coffee, so it does appeal to a certain crowd. There is nothing wrong with that at all, that is why we have brands like BMW, and Prada - people like nice things. 

People also like to be treated nice. I have been to a lot of coffee shops in my life, and the ones that stand out in my mind aren't always the ones with exceptional coffee (that certainly helps), but the ones that have an open, comfortable, home-like vibe. Cartel is not like that - I think it starts with the employees. I have on more than one occasion said "how are you?" or "have a nice day" only to be ignored. It is the weirdest thing. 

I write this review not to criticize, but to critique. I feel somewhat alienated when I go into Cartel, it is a shame because it is close to where I live and work, and I really like the coffee, but out of principal I often avoid it.
Awesome, hidden gem in Tempe. If you are trying to escape the starbucks nation, go to cartel coffee lab. The iced coffee was especially refreshing.

The coffee here is outta this world!!! Been coming here for years and it's definitely my favorite coffee shop ever. Their cappuccino is so strong and perfect, lattes are great, cold brew is delicious, and their chai is amazing. Finally a place where the baristas do their jobs with such integrity, they are wizards. If you want quality, come here. The beans they sell are sourced from small scale farmers, which I appreciate, but can't afford. Lots of space with their expansions and lots of outlets. Sometimes the music is a bit too crazy, but that's just me. Bring headphones and you're set.
Many people hate on cartel for the 'too cool' vibe and perceived attitude that some baristas have, but I've found that if I am kind to them, they are kind back! Just my experience, but I wouldn't worry about it too much. Last time I was here I saw the most beautiful doggo ever and if you're lucky maybe you'll see him, he's big and fluffy and all black. Cross your fingers.

Boring Sunday and a sweet tooth hits so I end up at Cartel looking for cookies. They have three varieties and somehow due to miscommunication I wound up with all three varieties. The three cookies were placed in individual brown bags which all ended up looking like they contained a bag of french fries. Are cookies supposed to be that greasy to seep through the bag? The peanut butter version with peanut butter icing was below average, the cranberry/white chocolate variety was equally bad and the winner was the one that looked like an Oreo. Iced Mocha features get your own lid at this location, but not the best version in town.

Very good coffee, nice foam. Happy to have a place to leave my husband while I shop. There are power strips under the table and it seems like some people work from this coffee shop. Nice relaxed vibe, feels like the mission in SF.

I had a delicious latte here. They say they have the best espresso maker in town, and it's kind of hard to argue. This place is hipster supreme to the max and way better than any other coffeehouse in Tempe (sorry, Gold Bar, I've betrayed you). 

My favorite thing about Cartel (besides the strong brew, of course)? They play damn good tunes all the time. There's no better soundtrack in the Valley. They also have art for sale that's actually affordable (and usually quite interesting). And people are nice here... what a concept. I'm glad they're into the green movement using "plastic" cups made of 100% corn. Downside: I wish they had longer hours and more comfy chairs. Those plastic fold-up chairs really suck compared to the comfy couches.

This place seriously has the best coffee, lattes, hot chocolate and chai tea i've ever had, period!

I was visiting my brother and he insisted on taking me here, to which I replied, I only drink hot chocolate, no coffee or tea. Well, did i eat or should i say drink those words.

We ordered a latte, chai tea and hot chocolate and i was singing their praises all the way home. This is not an ordinary coffee shop - all three drinks were rich, creamy and had wonderful flavors - i was completely blown away!

If i lived here, i'd definitely be a coffee and chai tea drinker, but sadly i don't - though this place is on my "must visit" list next time i'm in town.

I go to school downtown and I need a mid-day coffee fix at least two or three times per week.  Cartel is conveniently located a block away from my school, so it would seem to be a good choice.

I will give them credit where credit is due... the vanilla nonfat latte was pretty good. I would definitely order it again if I were to go back.

But I will absolutely not be going back.  In fact, let me preface this comment by saying that I have actually never written a yelp review before, but my experience at Cartel was so horrible, that I decided to open an account to share my opinion about this place with others.  I have never encountered such appallingly rude and just downright nasty barristas.  I went in with a few friends from class and we all left feeling similarly disrespected.  The girl who took our orders had long dark hair and was super skinny... What is her deal?? Did your dog just die or something? Would it kill you to show even a hint or smile or to just pretend to be deriving some pleasure from working at Cartel? After my friends and I got our drinks, we hung out for a little while and talked, but when it was time to head back to class, one of my friends had not finished her drink yet, so she asked a barrista for a to-go cup.  After asking, the barrista looked at her and essentially rolled her eyes, appalled that someone would ask her to do such a demanding and burdensome task.

I have worked in a restaurant. I know what it is like to work in this type of industry.  I am always respectful of servers and people who take my orders, and I will give them very hefty tips if I feel like they are genuine and if they are doing their best to take care of me.  However, when people are as disrespectful as these young ladies, it makes me not want to go back to that establishment and give them my money.  These two girls were so incredibly impolite, unwelcoming, and unpleasant (agreed upon by the other three ladies I was with and myself) that I will not be going back to Cartel.

If you're downtown and you want great drinks and pastries, accompanied by fantastic service, go to One Coffee at Washington and Central.  The staff that works there is phenomenal and they're always happy and eager to help.  Polar opposites from the girls I encountered at Cartel.

Best coffee in Phoenix. Period.  Likely the the best in Arizona, and perhaps one of the best in the US.  Lofty claims, yes, but in all my travels I've found very few places that serve coffee on this level. Cheers!

The BEST cappuccino I've had in a long time, and it happened to be at Phoenix Airport!!

Did you know that Cartel Coffee Lab...
--1. is local company founded in Tempe Arizona (six location to serve you and growing)
--2. Jason Silberschlag, is the owner of Cartel Coffee Lab, and a native of Tucson and also a University of Arizona alumni.
--3. Cartel Coffee Lab roast their own coffee beans
--4. there is no take out so you have to sit and enjoy your espresso and cappuccino, just like the Italians in Italy. LOL :p (good way to catch up on your Yelping while enjoying your favorite beverage).
--5. Their pastries.... oh my, I recommend their Banana Bread, it was just fantastic.
--6. Best of the best, excellent customer service!!

Cartel Coffee Lab was "named" 1 of 9 BEST COFFEE in the USA!!  I believe it.  Checkout the interview with owner Jason at Arizona Daily Wildcat: http://www.wildcat.arizona.edu/article/2014/01/qa-cartel-coffee-lab-owner-jason-silberschlag

Until then, Cheers! ~ :p

Cartel coffee is my favorite coffee bar none. I usually get my coffee to go and don't hang out, but the ambiance in the place is very good. Exactly what I would hope for in a coffee shop. I love ever coffee drink they serve. From dirty chai to just a plain black cup of coffee, I'm in love with it all.

Probably the least busy of the Cartel Coffee I've been too. I LOVE the coffee here. Cartel always gives high quality coffee no matter how you order it. Also this spot in downtown Phoenix is prime for people watching, especially around comic con time in the summer.
Great coffee so far at the 2 locations I've visited. Hipster haven lol, better have a MacBook.
Reasonably priced, well made coffee with a great variety of not only coffee, but ways to make it.

This place is really cool. Good coffee, the staff was nice, and my coffee cake was good. It's super cool that they also have a handful of beers on tap, one of them, Mr. Pineapple, had me drooling- it looked so good.

The ambiance is really cool and comfortable and looks like a great place to sit and chill. It would be cool if they had a few more baked goods for morning grab and goes, but there is only so much space.

Cartel is yet another great reason to support local coffee, skip the chains- and enjoy.

Hands down, the best coffee slash coffee experience I have ever had in an airport.  It felt like a little oasis with prime people watching in a busy terminal with baristas that are kind and care about the process.

Let's talk about the process. I have magnificent friends who are supreme baristas because they love the process. It's quite evident here that the all of the people and products here are dedicated to the process of creating quality. Come here for a drink made with intention and enjoy every sip.

I ordered a cappuccino. It was perfectly made with just the right amount of flavor and foam on top. One of the best parts was I enjoyed it from a real coffee cup - not a to-go one. 

This is one of those places where I will intentionally be early for my flight so I can spend time here!

We go to Arizona every year to visit family but this is the first time we "reached out" to find out where the good coffee lives. A local told us about Cartel, which was located on Memory Lane for my wife, so it was easy to find ("just past where I used to drink a giant soda before working at the vintage clothing store and or record store.") . It seemed like we were going to someone's apartment, but behind the door, shockingly enough, was a comfortable coffee shop with easily the best drip coffee I've had during six Christmas trips to The Zona. I bought a bag of beans to take back and the gentleman told me "19$ a bag...and worth every penny." I just made a cup in Oakland, CA and I have to agree. My one qualm: their incredibly nice and comfortable t-shirts accentuate my man boobs.

Fantastic coffee and staff who are both knowledgeable and patient. If you come at a peak time, be prepared to wait in line for a while, and to bump elbows with strangers at a table. Hands down my favorite cold coffee in Arizona.

I actually stopped in here twice on Monday: once for an iced chai latte and again later to try one of the house coffees (el bosque). Both were excellent! Service was super good; the baristas were vey friendly and even brought my coffee out to me! I can tell this place is a quick stop for people traveling in and out of the downtown area, so I wish I had went to one of the more loungier spots. Would definitely check out another location on my next trip!

Stopped in today to sample some of their brewery offerings since it was near where I was staying. Sat at the bar and tried the 5 beers on tap, then ordered 2 10oz pours of 2 of them. 

Had a pretty good time here, the place is actually rather spacious once you get inside and had plenty of seating options. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The beers themselves were kind of hit or miss, I had higher hopes for the brown ale since it featured their coffee but it was rather "odd". A weird kind of hoppy bitterness that I didn't really expect at all. APA and Pale Ale were so so but I did rather enjoy the DIPA, and the grapefuit wit wasn't bad either.

In PHX. In Terminal 4, C Terminal (Southwest Airlines). Very fru-fru. They do Aero-Press coffee! I'm impressed. It's the first time I've seen an Aero-Press used in a commercial shop. They also do expresso and Chemex. Worth the walk and the wait for a good cup of coffee.

This is the place to go if your looking for an outstanding cup of gourmet coffee. The staff is seriously knowledgable about the entire process and will gladly give you an information overload if you ask, even if they do so with a hipster poise (it doesn't really bother me when they have some useful nuggets of knowledge to back up their hipness).

Local artists regularly grace the walls with their artwork and you will always find a variety of artists, designers, developers, and general hip folk typing away on their respective mac book pros.

Haters gonna hate, but I love this place. Truly original.

Mmmmm. Rich frothy crema on top of my espresso drink with a pretty design!  Service was friendly and very accommodating. They carried out our order and anticipated our needs, bringing dishes and extra utensils. Super cool environment with inside and out seating, wifi was free and restrooms were clean and easily accessible.

Really nice set up. Great coffee, great service, understated and interesting layout. Almost a conservative industrial interior decoration with artistic and contemporary sensibilities. Interesting choice of art displays that reflect the feeling of the overall scene. All the staff I have encountered are very friendly with genuine personalities. I look forward to making at least one trip back before my conference ends, and will surely be back again next time I am in Phoenix.

This coffee shop is pretty dope. They have beer, and coffee how could you go wrong right?!? 
It's located in old town, so day dependent parking can be a challenge. 
They have a lot of space to sit down and work, or make calls. 
They only have two size cups. I believe it's 8oz and 16oz, but don't bite my head off of those aren't the exact sizes but two sizes regardless. 
Place has a little bit of a hipster vibe, and they definitely take their time making the coffee. I know a great latte is worth a bit of a wait but this wait (with no one ahead of me) was overly long. So I wouldn't go there if i was rushing to work but I would certainly head over on a casual Saturday or a late start day.
Really cool spot, good beer, cool vibe, Hipster feel,  Good place to hang with friends or study.  Different rooms have a different setting, so it can be social or quieter.

Very cute area and place.  Cleverly designed.  Nice staff.  Cool, hip vibe.  Good chocolate chip cookie.  But, the main reason for my visit was to have my favorite drink I test everywhere - the mocha.  Unfortunately, it disappointed.  A bit bitter, not a smooth mocha.  It was actually the 3rd bad mocha I got trying different independent cafes in the Phoenix area over my vacation.  Maybe Phoenix just isn't a mocha town.  I'd probably go back and try a different drink.

My favorite coffee shop in AZ, wish they would come out to Dallas!!! They've grown a lot in their locations and I even found them in the Airport! They have the best iced chai and iced coffee around. Everything is done to perfection to provide only the best coffee experience. As a proclaimed coffee expert, this is where my love for the "real deal" began- at their Tempe location about 5yrs ago :)

Located in Old Town on a street with unique stores. The "lab" was trendy and had a hipster feel. The guy with the samurai man-bun took my order and did a phenomenal job explaining to me all the fancy coffee on their menu. I ended up with the simple mocha which came with an awesome latte art. The taste was not all that exceptional and it didn't give me an energy surge like my usual black coffee. I'll have to go back and try some of their other more unique options under "filter" and espresso. Overall, it was a good alternative if you don't want boring ol' Starbucks. It can be a little pricey, $5 ish for a large mocha.

Fairly 'Boh Chic' yet a simple and inviting environment for superior coffee in many ways. We stopped by after sad restaurant brew and were elated. Came back 2nd day passing the drip pots w/ single origin washed varietals and waited for a pour-over. 
Excellent.
This wet wash process takes full advantage of  flavors otherwise discarded in the other methods. Fruit flavors like strawberry, watermelon, or other light aromatics is not your typical canned bean experience.
Highly recommended.

I enjoy trying coffee at different coffee shops. Since I was visiting the Tempe area I thought I would try the cold brew at Cartel. I'm on a hunt for a really good (Nitro) Cold Brew! I didn't really enjoy the cold brew from Cartel. The cold brew was bitter and put on ice. After some of the ice melted, it was tolerable.
As soon as I received my coffee, the cashier turned around and went behind the wall to play on his phone. First time in the coffee shop and I had to search for the location where the lids and other condiments were located.

The "meh, I've experienced better" tag to 3 stars perfectly explains how I feel about Cartel. I don't understand the hype behind this coffee 'lab'.

I was walking around downtown Phoenix, and I passed Cartel enough that I thought it may offer the perfect pick me up to get through the day. A three hour time difference isn't a huge deal, but when you inadvertently wake up at 6am every morning because that's what you're used to, a coffee is always welcomed. 

Cartel is a no-frills, to the point shop tucked away in an office building. I was kind of bummed that there was no outdoor seating area, as my goal was to sit and enjoy the weather until I needed to pick my friend up from work. I yelped before buying because I was hoping there was another coffee shop around that had an outdoor patio for me to hang out on. Oddly enough, Cartel seems to have put some monopoly of some sort as I couldn't find anything similar in the surrounding area. I was shocked considering I was in the middle of the metro. Defeated, I decided I'd buy a cup and continue walking around downtown. 

I wanted a cappuccino, but I guess they do it the "proper" way, which means that you get a tiny ass cup 'as that's how they do it in Italy.' Ah, okay. This isn't what I thought I was signing up for, but okay. The employees aren't pretentious, but they mean business when it comes to coffee. There are no cutesy snacks to dip. There are no seats to waste your day away. This is a "I'm going to give you what I believe coffee should be and nothing else" type of place.
