Bad coffee, great atmosphere and wonderful teas. Coffee falls short since it has a sour and dirty after taste. However, the teas are bold in flavor and the atmosphere is the best place to study.

So as usual I dragged my a$$ over to the airport at 5 AM Monday morning to catch the 6 am to SJC. Had overslept so did not have time to enjoy my morning Nespresso. Looked at the long line at the Starbucks, decided to skip it and go to C18 resigned to the thought of having the cardboard coffee in the plane. When I neared the gate, the smell of coffee dragged me to the Cartel kiosk...seeing no one in the line, I half halfheartedly ordered the Latte, thinking this will be yet another cooked coffee from another Espresso machine.

To my surprise I got a latte with a coffee leaf in my cup, which in itself woke me up, and I took one sip of the coffee.... Wow !!! (Imagine me standing like that guy in Ratatouille, this coffee took me back to the super strong South Indian coffee that Mom used to make) 

I plan to go to the Airport early, and trek all the way to C13 no matter where my flight is to get this coffee every time I am in Skyharbor.

My husband and I have been stopping here on the weekends recently.  The staff is always super friendly and their drinks are great.  I've never like coffee.  Ever.  I've tried it a couple times throughout my life and it's just never done it for me, so I've always been a tea girl.  THEN, my husband and I went to Cartel one day and while he was tending to our toddler, I went to put some cream in his iced coffee.  I had a little bit of an overflow dilemma, and there were no towels or any potential clean up devices in sight.  So I was forced to take a sip to prevent the spill... and I was shocked and pleasantly surprised that I actually LIKED the coffee!  It wasn't bitter or nasty at all.  Very smooth and delicious, and creamy because of, well, the cream.  My poor husband only got to drink about half his coffee that day, and then deal with me being wired for the next few hours.

The usual tea I get there is always great, too.  I've only tried one so far, the black mango pineapple (or something along those lines) and it's delish!  Mildly sweet and fruity, extremely yummy.  

I like the way the interior is designed, with bike tires and interesting photos on the walls.  My toddler loves to look around and inquire about what everything is.  There's never been a long wait and we've been there at different times on weekend mornings.  Early-ish, and later towards the afternoon.  Never overly crowded, never empty.  We'll be back again and again because now I'm hooked on their iced coffee.  It only took 27 years.

This is the smoothest cappuccino in Phoenix. Great offerings of classic drinks and diverse cold brew options that are all out of this world. Their baristas truly go above and beyond to make sure your drink is perfect!
 I can't come here without grabbing a bag of beans to make at home! Convenient locations around town make it easy to always get a great cup when you need one. 

One caveat: not a lot of bathroom options. There was a long line and it wasn't the cleanest, but otherwise 10/10!

The best coffee shop in Phoenix. I've had everything from cappuccinos to their cold brew and never been disappointed. Also plenty of space to spread out and get some work done if you need to get out of the office.

This place is not for me. Their cold brew is ok. Nothing to write home about. Baked goods are great. They come from Phoenix public market which is a fantastic place. I tried the airopress which was better then the drip coffee. The place was dirty and unorganized. I enjoyed the vibe there. All in all, not bad product. It's not enough to get me to come back though. :/

Was turned on to Cartel by a friend. My first visit I wasn't really sure what to order. Menu is kinda bare but I think that's the point. The barista was very friendly and more than happy to give me different recommendations. Their cold brew is their staple and is the best cold brew I have had in town. The environment is a little hipster but it is nice and plenty of places to sit and charge your laptop or phone. Highly recommend Cartel.

One of the hippest coffee spots around.... Old Scottsdale.

This is the place to be for strong delicious coffee!!

Amazing!!!! The best coffee I have ever tasted, and the best chai I have ever tasted.  I had been wanting to try it out, and I picked my Uncle up from the airport and he wanted some coffee, so I knew I wanted to come here... My Uncle (AKA Funkle - funny Uncle) is diabetic, so he wanted some splenda with his breve (if that is how it is spelt), and the guy said they try and make the coffee good enough that it doesn't need sugar, he was RIGHT!! I was the best coffee I have ever tasted.  You can tell they know what they are doing and are passionate about it.  I will be here ever time I'm on this side of town!!

Who doesn't love little hearts in their cappuccino? 

A bit intimidating to visit the first time or two, especially if you are by yourself.  The place was packed, but everyone was super into their laptops, and just sneaking covert glances over top to see who came and went.  Drinks take a while to come out (which is fine - hearts take time) but I felt a bit scrutinized while waiting.  (I was dressed biz-casual as I work nearby and felt like I was dressed to the nines in a dive bar.)

Anyway, aside from the bit of awkwardness I experienced, my cappuccino was delish, and I love that they serve in actual glass glasses and not plastic cups.  (They're called glasses for a reason people!)

I will be back, and as long as I arm myself with a "devil may care" attitude if I'm wearing work attire, I know it will be an enjoyable visit.

We came to the down town location for the first time yesterday and I was even more impressed.  The service was sooo nice, the food was great, and the coffee was to die for of course.  We had the breakfast sandwich with bacon and the burrito with bacon, they were both great, I liked the sandwich the best, the chipotle made it sooo yummy.  They aren't small, we could have shared one and been full.

Your experience really depends on who is working when you arrive.  One time that I came the barista was enthusiastic and helpful.  The second time, the person working literally did not speak to us.  It was quite awkward.  Overall, cartel sells great beans and makes a great cup of coffee.  Its not always a great experience though.

I stopped in after running the RNR Marathon this past weekend.  I ordered a Clever of the guji from the board.  Overall, it was a pretty good cup of coffee.  Not my favorite (I'm a huge yirgacheffe fan), but good.  I also tried the cherry pop-tart, which was amazing!  I highly recommend!  Great neighborhood coffee shop.  I'll definitely stop back in if I'm in the area again!

Flying out of Sky Harbor early AM, what a great.  Worth the wait.  Try something u inquest and you won't be disappointed.  One and one was delicious and fun to watch the preparation.  Try a cold brew, I did t try one, but appreciated the handcrafted one I saw being made.
Love their coffee, but I asked for almomd milk in my latte however they put regular milk in it which made my stomach upset. Always double check before you leave!
Really knowledgable here. Makes  coffee an experience rather than a product being sold. I had the Chemex, guy took pride in everything he was doing.

Great hipster place!  Love the atmosphere and the service was great! Very attentive and patient with little ol' indecisive me as the guy provided beer samples until we found just the right one I liked!  :) The organic sugar syrup for the coffee is a great touch too!! The regulars giggled as they watched me try to figure it out!! Definitely a great place to hang out... even solo!

Ok, this place has THE BEST coffee I have ever tasted.  Bottom Line.  I didn't get the "everyone is required to wear skinny jeans" vibe that a previous reviewer stated, so I would definitely give this place a try before writing it off.  If you love coffee, this place is not to be missed.  And I am not talking about the "Venti Chocolate Chip Frap" type of coffee.  If you like drinks like that then this place is not for you, but if you love the idea of each cup of coffee being made specifically for each customer and supporting an establishment that is truly passionate about their product, than check this place out.

One of the cool things about Phoenix Sky Harbor is that they are bringing in locally own businesses into the terminals for  all to try, I like that a lot!

I was searching for coffee and walked by Starbucks and saw the line was out the door so I just kept heading towards my gate and thank gawd I did, when I turned the corner I found Cartel Coffee!! Oh yes I was very happy.

The staff was friendly and helpful, I walked right up and ordered an large mocha, this was a great looking cup of coffee great tasting too! Loved it

If your looking for a cup of joe, you should skip Starbucks and head on over to Cartel Coffee forsure!

Microbrewery & coffee house? Hello Cartel where have you been hiding all this time!

Some have said if you want atmosphere head on over the Lux, but I think that's discrediting what Cartel has to offer.  Lux and Cartel Coffee are 2 different styles, respect the differences. 

Was in the area and found Cartel by fluke, I was in need of some coffee, yes I can admit I am a caffeine junkie and Cartel was my dealer, from the board above you can tell this a coffee joint (ok they have tea too if coffee isn't your thing).  I went with a Latte, which was perfectly blended with a cute little heart design, so sweet.  

With coffee in hand I gave this place a more through look threw, I like the vibe of it, lots of seating room. I didn't realize it was a microbrewery until I had the coffee in hand; I'm intrigued and need to come back and inspect that soon.

Since Cartel isn't that far from me I'm sure I will become a regular in no time haha.  Glad to find another place to get a good cup a joe.

CARTEL COFFEE LAB is awesome. The coffee is delicious and the staff very knowledgable and speaks to the detail of their coffee beans, roasting and preparation. The shop is tiny, clean and fresh. They also serve wine and beer. I didn't try any. Location 5th and Craftsman has plenty of free parking. There's also a cool bench out front where you can sit and sip.

Hands down the best coffee in town. Great atmosphere and setup for mobile working. I spent almost 4 months writing my dissertation there and the staff was always amazing. Still my go to place for working and enjoying a good espresso.

This was my first time coming here and I stumbled upon it after riding the light rail. The staff is incredibly friendly and made recommendations for what exactly to order. I settled on getting a cappuccino and they certainly did not disappoint! They did fun coffee art on top and the coffee itself was very strong! The prices are very fair and the atmosphere is really relaxing! I will definitely be back to explore more!

Iced coffee of the day heaven!! I am so excited, I can't stand it! Okay maybe not that excited, but you would be too if you had gone to 8 different places, and they all had terrible coffee. Why do so many places think that an iced coffee equates to melted ice cream in a cup, with a ton of sugar, and no coffee flavor? Anyway, I didn't experience any of the snobby behavior so many have commented on. In fact everyone was very helpful and friendly. I can't wait to come back and try more coffee!

I've been to this location once and I already love it. One of their expert baristas, Kelsey, is so friendly and personable. She truly knows how to do customer service well, which makes all the difference in the coffee experience. 

I ordered my go-to drink: a soy cappuccino. It's beautiful as always.
I waited for 5 minutes and the barista didn't even acknowledge me, he was just busy chatting with another customer. Never coming back to this location.

I walked here from Tempe Center for the Arts for a coffee during a break in the dress reharsal for Breaking Ground this weekend.

Very comfortable vibe, engaging barristas.

Truly excellent coffee.

I wish there were a place to sit outside though.

Instead, I drank mine while walking back to TCA.

Don't get to do that often enough in this Valley.

I'll be back to Cartel whenever I want sit-in coffee.
Cartel!! I want every flight to stop in PHX just to have this perfect coffee experience-- in an AIRPORT no less! Kudos-- this is amazing stuff.

Best iced coffee of my life. Unbelievable. So fresh, so good.

Very good tuna salad.

Gigantic animal heads on the wall: odd.

I love Cartel! It is always my routine to grab one on my way through the Southwest gate at Sky Harbor. If you have the time, definitely take a seat and let them brew you a fresh Chemex cup while you wait on your flight. You'll never want a "Charbucks" again! 
I love their location in downtown Scottsdale as well!

This is my go to for the past 5 years. Lately there has been hit or miss on cold brew, but other than that I love going to Cartel. They always have different coffee offerings, which is fun!

Parking can be rough with the restrictions on the North side of Cartel, so park in the rear (south side) to avoid a ticket!
This place is AMAZING! Megan was so delightful to work with that I can't wait to go back and hang out there again. Definitely a must visit!

Came here to Cartel Coffee Lab in C section of terminal 4 at the airport.  Quite frankly, we didn't want to walk all the way out to the Starbucks that was in the area after the TSA check so it was nice to stumble upon this gem.  

I got a small iced mocha and it was pretty good.  It was definitely better than what Starbucks has to offer.  My drink did take a while to make but I'll chalk it up to the baristas carefully crafting my beverage.  My flight was delayed by 20 minutes so I wasn't going anywhere anyway.  My friend got the spicy coffee (I forget the name) and it was quite unique. I've always wanted to try something like that but couldn't commit to a full drink.  It was definitely spicy.  I'm sure it's an acquired taste and lots of people like it, but I probably wouldn't want to be as adventurous next time.

I'll have to try some of their different offerings next time I'm there.

awesome.  Small, local spot -just what we look for when we travel.  After living in the Northwest (Seattle area) for a long while we've grown accustomed to outstanding coffee (NOT starbucks) and this place was great.  Atmosphere was really unique and laid back as well with semi-outdoor seating.  I also noticed they have a small but legit beer selection.  When I was there they had on tap Odell Mercenary IPA, Firestone Velvet Merlin, and a few others.  Whoever orders their beers obviously knows what good beer is.  We didn't end up getting any but a good sign nonetheless.  Service was good and they were friendly.  We ended up buying a mug because they are pretty cool too.  Overall, superb place to stop in and have a leisurely coffee.

Definitely going back next time we are in the Dale

Serious place with a very comfortable setup.  Didn't partake but appreciate the beer selections, more places should do this.  Espresso was excellent, didn't need sweetener like it does at some national chains.  Music selection was not my style (I am definitely older than the target market) but still interesting and enjoyable while working for a half hour.
Cute little place.  Would be good for people working, was just ok for hanging out.  Coffee was solid. Would definitely return when in the area.

This place has the best dirty chai in Tempe! Their other espresso drinks are also consistently good. The only downside is that unless I go early in the morning, the pastries get sold out before I get there. Also, there aren't many outlets so it's not good for laptop studying.

Great quality strong coffee. I always get an iced vanilla latte and the strength of the coffee is still so evident THE BEST COFFEE IN PHOENIX FOR WAKING YOU UP. Always does the job of keeping me awake throughout a busy day!

while waiting to check into my hotel, hung out here for a couple of hours. very good cappucino and iced coffee, delicious cookie, with free no hassle wifi, and cool vibe with seating options, clean huge windows and shared space with a yummy food business.  bookmarked!

The best espresso I've had so far. 

I purchase my coffee here as well. It's always delicious, never bitter and of very high quality.

This coffee shop is my all time fav. I hope they stay open indefinitely. If you are in the area try them out. They have beer too!
Great location and wonderful coffee! !  The atmosphere was also relaxed and a good place to hang out with friends or get some work done.  Enjoy it!!

One of the top coffee spots in the nation. Place is no joke and consistent in greatness... Not necessarily flavor profile as that obviously changes by season and bean and so on and so forth, but they truly have a great method on lock down from roasting to the baristas. 

Currently the yirg z from yirgacheffe is amazing on v60 and chemex. 

Also amazing  8oz americano to go... Yes you have to get it in a to go cup... Not sure why but it's never as good in a washed porcelain. Just have them wash out the paper cup. I swear it's a million times better. ;)
Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent coffee and pastries. Nice and relaxing atmosphere.

Enjoy the quality of espresso drinks :-) they have pour overs also; so far for the times I've come in, they bring my drink to me personally.  Excellent customer service!

They have a hardware-type decoration & furnishings.  Not my taste, but it's their identity, not mine.

I can only review based on coffee and a muffin but it was very good.  Super funky decor with chandeliers hanging low on the ground and brick face on walls.  Open kitchen created a wide roomy feel.  There were folks meeting and chatting over coffee.  

Service was very quick and good.  It was weird they didnt have a caramel latte on the menu but oh well.  The coffee was fine.  :-)

I have been trying to come here forever and finally made it out on a Friday night.  I was surprised by the lack of a crowd.  Mistake number one was not listening to the honest barista.  I asked how was the decaf brew, and he provided an honest answer of "not so good, I would not recommend it."  

Unfortunately he was correct.  The decaf Americano was bland and watery.  There was no depth, no roasted taste, really disappointing. 

I should have listened and avoided the decaf products.

I am so not impressed with cartel coffee. For starters the front counter help gentleman is a rude little pretentious snot.  It was beneath him to be polite and he wasn't hesitant to demonstrate that to me. After making me feel completely wrong for not ordering the correct cartel way... The icing on the cake with this gentleman was the fact that when I asked for a receipt he looked at me like I had four eyes. It turns out they only offer an email or text message receipt. I appreciate the idea of going green but sometimes a paper receipt is required.

My next encounter which was unfortunate was when my four drinks were ready... I asked if I could have the drinks marked and again this is against cartels policy. I was told that I would have to figure it out based on whether not they cups have a paper sleeve on them. That's kind of crazy since I have four different drinks.

I appreciate the idea of being a hipster joint or fashion week cool but not at the cost of customer service and customer appreciation. Maybe I'm just too darn old to order coffee in a college town. Then again, maybe Cartel should expect their employees to treat their paying customers with respect. 

Next time I'll... Who am I kidding?  It'll be a month of Sunday's before there is a next time.
Extremely slow service even though they weren't busy, got the order wrong, stay away from this place.
Definitely a very good craft coffee roaster. I enjoyed their Colombian single origin espresso and pour over. Great washed coffee with very buttery notes and a sweet, clean finish.

When the barrista poured my latte with a little leaf design in the foam, I was instantly in love.  I felt like I was back at Stumptown Coffee Roasters in my beloved Portland, OR.  The vanilla latte I ordered was smooth and delicious.  It was just the right temperature so I didn't have to blow on it for half an hour just to take a sip.  For coffee like this, you're gonna pay a little more, but frankly it's worth it.  Pass Starbucks quickly and head to Cartel in terminal 4.

Upon entering, I was immediately struck by the amazing playlist blasting through the speakers.  Yes, it was pretty loud, but when you've got MC Hammer jamming, loud is totally cool with me.  Do these Millennials even know who MC Hammer is?  Probably not.  The atmosphere is great, but the coffee is even better.  My hubby got one of those slow drip coffee things where it eliminates all the bitterness and really brings out the flavors of the beans.  He was a big fan of his.  I was loving my dirty iced chai.  This is one of those places that helps make Tempe as cool as it is.

price, flavor, service all fantastic. If you like good coffee, go. If you don't care about coffee, stop looking at coffee reviews and just go get your grande double whip hazelnut bullshit and stop pretending like you like anything but coffee flavored milk sugar.

Meh. 
Coffee is very acidic. 
Not very impressive, felt like I just added a spritz of lemon into my coffee.

Terrific coffee. So smooth. I had a mocha and lemon bread. So tasty. I can see why they are voted as one of the best coffees in Phoenix. 
Friendly staff. Will make just about any coffee drink you want. 
Sandwiches, salads, pastries. Something for everyone. A great stop for food and drink in between flights. Go there.

This is one of my favorite coffee spots.  They make one of the best vanilla lattes I've ever had.  The new cold brew floats look out of this world.  If there's a negative about this place, it's that it's not a place to go when you're in a hurry.  The staff are perfectionists about their craft, sometimes to the detriment of timely and/or friendly service.
Best vanilla latte anywhere.

Cool, hipster vibe. I really like the feel of the place, with recycled artwork and interesting, comfortable seating areas. The baristas were hipster as well, but were very friendly. Coffee was ready fast considering there was a line. I just got an Americano, which was decent - kind of strong for me, but I didn't want to use syrup as a sweetener. Anyway, I want to try other things, like the toddy. The rest of the menu doesn't seem very fancy, just the basics. It's nothing too elaborate, but I can't complain.
Best coffee on the west Coast! Takes about 15 min to brew a cup but it is well worth the wait. Great place

Flying from El Paso to San Diego I had a stop in Phoenix at the airport. A friend of mine suggested trying Cartel.  Loved it. The cashier was friendly, attentive and quick. She took my order and it was ready in a minute. 

The  large coffee ($4.00) was fresh and didn't  need sugar or cream. I had 20 minutes before my next flight and this quick fix got me through it.

Thanks Cartel!
I just wanted to add that they've added snacks to the menu. My next visit was better!

The barista held nothing back in describing the flavor characteristics of their roasted beans, and helped me pick out the perfect coffee for me, it being my first time in the shop.  I eventually settled on the 24-hour cold brew coffee, which is amazing, an I'm looking forward to trying their other flavors.  

Big pluses are the friendly barista, atmosphere, and quality.  I'll definitely be coming back Macbook in hand to spend some more quality time here.  Maybe I'll be lucky enough to find some people to play chess with or make interesting conversation.
Atmosphere is awesome and coffee good.  Great alternative to my usual Starbucks

Drinking coffee and Espresso has become my new hobby (or dare I say obsession) due in large part to the opening of this funky and original coffee Lab.  The passion of the owner, to stay true to traditional barista ways, is nothing short of extraordinary.  While enjoying one of their amazing drinks, the thought comes to mind, this is what coffee is supposed to taste like!!  Darn the behemoths of the coffee industry for herding us like cattle through their identical shops while shoving expensive sub par coffee our way.  I say no more!  I want to sip a perfectly made drink in a place that feels like home.  Cartel Coffee Lab is that place.  The sweet and fragrant smell of the freshly roasted beans lingers in the air.  I almost feel like the owner should charge for the smell alone.  Because the beans are roasted on site, you truly can not get a fresher cup of coffee anywhere.  There are no old pots of coffee hanging out indefinitely on their warmers.  Every cup of coffee is brewed fresh for around $1.  I know, don't even get me started on the prices!  Your buck is definitely getting "banged" at this place.  This place will not disappoint!!

They sell a stimulant from South America and are called "Cartel."

A joke's hiding in there, somewhere. 

Stopped by for the first time today. It wasn't easy to find, but that made it fun.  (Look in the BACK of the shopping center). I'm sure it's easy to miss!

All I have to say about my visit is... DAMN these guys serve a great cuppa joe. One of the best I've had. Ever.
Great coffee place. If I have any length of a layover I'll always run down to Cartel. Good quality coffee.

So busy I walked in and walked out and then scoffed at by one of the employees. Good luck getting a parking lot - and if so, a seat. I don't see what is so great about this place.. maybe they need another location nearby? Hipster crowd, yes, definitely.

Really good coffee & food.  I admit I wish they were open more into the evening time.  
What really caught my eye was the layout of the cafe.  They really did a great job designing this place.

Best cold brew I have had yet. Excellent shop as they also roast their beans in house. Bought a bag of beans and will be coming back here for sure. Plenty of floor space for sitting and a good mix of pastries.

My morning coffee is a must. Thankfully, Cartel is conveniently located near the office and hotels when I'm up in Scottsdale for work. This particular location, as mentioned before is a little snug compared to the stores we have in Tucson, but I like the coziness. Their no "to go cappuccino" policy is my only quibble. I totally get that they don't want to compromise the quality of their coffee with to go orders, but sometimes the customer needs it to go! Most importantly though, it's how the staff delivers the news. I appreciate the clever barista that was able to accommodate my Cortado order in a To go cup, how? He was creative

I couldn't agree more with Lindsey D's sentiment- that it's totally worth the walk to Terminal 4 to enjoy a cup of coffee that delicious and local! Not to mention, actually worth the money. Cartel coffee is truly a gem not only in Phoenix, but we're lucky to have to stores in Tucson. They don't compromise on quality, so don't plan on taking that cappuccino to go! Sip on that coffee and enjoy....take a moment to block out the hectic energy of the airport. That's what this coffee stop is all about. They roast their beans locally and bake all of their own pastries fresh. A rare find in any airport.

Grabbed a green iced tea while out running around. Great service and great tea! WIFI here and great sitting place to come and relax with friends or to even do some work. Am told this is the first of their locations that now are in Scottsdale and a couple in Phoenix and Tucson! Definately should make it one of your coffee stops where ever you are!

Seriously? It's been a couple years since I've reviewed Cartel and I just want to give 'em kudos again. Thank you universe for this little beaut and the fast, amazing baristas that run the place. When 1pm lunch rolls around nothing sounds better than running to Cartel from work for a pick me up and they never, ever fail me.

Another Yelp bookmarked place that was a winner! Ended up heading over to this area since we were going into the HTC place just next door to this particular location. We opted to give them a try since we were right there and this place had been on our list for some time.  

I'm a big fan of coffees, primarily hot mochas. As such, I ordered a medium hot mocha with much anticipation for good coffee, given the great reviews here, and was not disappointed. Not only was the coffee good, but the barista took the time to make a fun heart with the foam on the top of my coffee, which I just love! Art made of coffee? I mean who doesn't love that?

We revisited them a couple more times since then, and the coffee and service are consistent and excellent, which is what coffee persons want in a coffee shop, right? 

There are plenty of places to sit inside and some of these are located next to power sources for those that are looking to bring in a laptop and do other things while you're here. It's definitely geared towards the student and hipster crowds, and we aren't either of those things, but we didn't feel judged or unwanted despite it. We have gotten a negative vibe from some other coffee houses in town that have similar demographic crowds, but not here!

Overall: A
Fun artsy feel, great consistent coffee, quick service and fun foam designs!

Was pretty skeptical about coming to this place reading the previous reviews about customer service and the ambiance. 

We ended up coming here forcing ourselves because the reviews about "the best coffee in town" really did catch my attention. We come in through the back and come to the counter asking if we came through the wrong door. The cashier really didn't mind and told us how many doors to the coffee shop their actually was - there are three. 

We come from the whole Starbucks iced caramel macchiato scene so we weren't too sure what to order. We asked the barista what she'd recommend to someone who enjoyed an iced CM from Starbucks and she mentioned the agave latte, white mocha, or the regular latte.

I'm pleased to announce that the agave latte is divine. The natural sweetener has a certain taste alongside the espresso.

My sister and my experience here could not have been more pleasing. Definitely coming back. :)

Pros:
1. The best thing about this place is the vibe - Spacious, chill and hip but not over the top (well, maybe a little)
2. Really good, delicious coffee
3. The corn cookie, which reminded me of a giant sweet cornflake

Con:
Why the plastics cups for iced drinks when they ask you to stay or to go? Seems wasteful, especially when there is a simple solution.

Tip:
One hour means one hour. Verbatim note from the parking patrol who apparently take their job very seriously.  Be careful you don't get a parking ticket coming here.

This is it... I love coffee! Too much! I fu(kn hate starbucks and every time i'm dragged to the lowest point in existence and grovel at the coffee god's and give in to there powers and have a starbuck's coffee only because i am in an airport i am quickly reminded of why american consumerism taste like burnt toast from old tires on your grand dad's dentures (whatever that means) anyways the coffee angel's have been conspiring in my corner and every time i visit my earthly father in Arizona a bit of heaven forms in the magic we humans call coffee. Cartel kills it!!! Their espresso is socks and pant dropping, the frothy emotional appeal from the crema is enough to make a 14 year old boy have his first... And the finish dances a nutty smooth magic down the back of the tongue with the perfect amount of bitter and sweet on the sides and front. Onto the coffee, shit$ ill wit it g'unit! Great selection, choices on prep from chemix to clever to aero to hario to magic unicorns of cafe en tu boca!! And they have the option to serve everything in ceramic because lets be honest, if your as fukin gangster coffee drinker like me you don't mess with paper. Save trees beaches! Also If you like double mocha caramel frappa dappa doo da chinos with vanilla chocolate doo doo drippings, fear not!! Theres starbucks all over this airport;-) Ok and here is the best part: the employees!! Imagine smooth butter meets fresh blackberry and mango preserved atop honey agave dripping goodness of love magic... Thats the flavor of customer service! But on the real real they are beyond knowledgable and so open and nice about their mad skills. I know a litl about coffee so it's nice to pretend that i'm a wizard and then ask questions and still get a smile and some love from the original ganstarista's at Cartel. They were even out of bagged beans for sale and made a custom one for me and still gave me a free cup with it! ONE LOVE, ONE MIC, ONE PULL, ONE ESPRESSO TO RULE THEM ALL haha but ya its pretty good, thanks guys Nicholas and then two other good looking peeps (beautiful girl with tattoo of lotus, dark hair of the elvish maybe a direct descendent of liv tylers character in lord of the rings, and then a handsome young lad with dirty blonde ruffled hair of the gypsies and David Hasselhof from his early years in baywatch) who's name i didn't get but energies were appreciated!! for my delicious boost so i could write this radically long and super informative but serious review. Peace to the middle east~~~

I like the atmosphere of this place - it's pretty laid back, they have a mix of seating types and seem to have enough outlets for everyone. I also like that they have the usual coffee fare as well as a bar.

The teas that I've tried taste good, but it's hard to drink because they leave all of the tea in the glass when they serve it to you, so it gets stuck on your lips/ face/ teeth. Kind of weird. I haven't tried the coffee yet but am looking forward to it.

A great reprieve from the normal coffee production systems in our airports and towns. Great coffee/expresso/latte's etc, good selection of pressed juices and pastries that are far superior to what you have to put up with in Starbucks, Peets et al.

I have never found another place where they roast their beans and brew their own beer!

I am not a coffee person but I could tell from everyone consuming the coffee including family members that this in house roasted coffee was very good. The coffee shop has a great vibe.  This isn't your corporate coffee shop in the least!  

Where they really excel in my books is that they have a small nano brewery at the back of the shop with a small tasting room lounge.  They brew multiple styles of beer including an Amber Rye, Double IPA and a Pale Ale if I remember correctly and it seems these change with the season.

If you find yourself in Tempe check this place out!

How many great things can one say about the Cartel? Does Infinity work! Yes, that was a statement, not a question. I am in love with the CC, hands down. I have traded my gold Starbucks card in for this amazingly Delicious start to my day. The iced coffee ( actually, its Toddy, which is better) is amazing. They roast their own beans, and allow the iced coffee to sit over night, creating an extremely potent concoction. The hot drinks, A+++ as well. And, the food? A+++++ (5, yup its that legit). Grab the cheddar bacon muffin... its literally heaven. No joke. Heaven. Little clouds may form above your head; white clouds of course! Not those nasty rain clouds. OK, maybe not clouds. But defiantly your day will be sunny because you stopped into Coffee Cartel. And not because you live in AZ. Duh. 

Only complaint I have is the hours. I live right next door, and their only open M-F (like so many places in DT-Pho). 

PLLLEEEEAAAASSSEEEEEE open up for the weekends!!! I'll work for free! Well...wait... I'll come visit.

Meh.  Ordered a regular Latte and a Chai Tea Latte, both were good, I can't say that it was better than anywhere else I've tried.  However it's a really cool environment for studying or hanging out with some friends, some really good lounging areas.  The only reason I give it 3 stars was because the sizes of the drinks were REALLY tiny, like a child's size.  All in all, if I were in the area I'd probably stop by again.
A coffee house for the eclectic and the intellect. Great coffee, but served differently. Great space in terms of atmosphere and a place to do your work on the computer.

My $6.00 iced soy latte was bomb! It's coffee the way it should be; not that fake foo foo stuff we pay for at places that don't really profess to know about coffee bean origins. Here at Cartel you see the coffee beans in action. Love the ambiance at this place; it's a "see & be seen" type of vibe, so grab your prescription glasses, MacBook, iPhone and get ready for some of the best coffee you've ever had. Order a pour over which is made with one of the daily coffee varietals of your choice for a true taste of how this place gets down. They do coffee right. Reminds me of one of my favorite spots in Cali - Portola Coffee Lab inside the OC Mix - I love this place!

I don't drink coffee, my tummy doesn't like it...well I should say it gets VERY angry when I drink even diluted coffee drinks.

The interior is trendy urban industrial, and there's a huge fan to keep their covered outside area as cool as possible (still not cool in AZ summer, but I appreciate the obvious effort).

I've only had two drinks here: the iced chai latte and the orange blossom beer, both of which went down quick and well.

Orange Blossom Beer is locally brewed and has a persistent orange sicle note. Yum!
Cartel has an amazing atmosphere and their drinks are amazing - I am only sad that they don't have honey any more!

Finally getting around to trying this place as it has such high reviews and also was highly recommended by my barista/coffee snob sister.

Yes, I enjoyed my vanilla latte very much. Their espresso is excellent. I also had the coffee cake which was fresh and delicious. I also thought the decor was unique and interesting. Their espresso machine is a work of art in and of itself!

Things I wasn't thrilled about...if you're not a hipster or student you will feel out of place (because you are!). I walked in with my 2 year old son and felt like people were throwing daggers at me with their eyes. I also didn't appreciate the pretentious barista who seemed dead set on letting me know just how ignorant I was about coffee. They also don't post their prices which I thought was super annoying.

So basically I would give them 5 stars for their espresso, baked goods , and atmosphere. 0-1 for the customer service and I land at a 3 stars.
Just what you would expect at the airport. No seating over priced not enough staff to serve the traffic.
BEST COFFEE. I buy a bag of beans every week. Friendly employees, lots of different options for the more distinguished coffee drinker. Try the cold brew when you go.
I came here before the Giants/Dbacks Opening Day game and ordered the iced hazelnut latte. The latte was good but not the best I've had. I would come back if I'm in the area in the near future.
Best espressp I've had in awhile. Love how knowledgable the staff is.

Meh. 

Being from LA I crave real coffee when traveling. 

While I appreciate the notion of great espresso in an airport, the hype was too built up. 

Vibe and baristas were very friendly, and the food offering has healthy options (much appreciated!). 

Thank you for providing almond milk! Cappuccino was not as bold, too acidic, and not as flavorful as expected. 

A great alternative to Starbucks/Peets, but I'm comparing it to stand alone coffee joints. 

Meh.

Cartel Coffee Lab and barista Ryan at Sky Harbor International is a credit to the company. I had a few minutes and was feeling a need for a cup of coffee. Ryan was cheerful and eager. More importantly he was friendly. Ryan could have just pressed the vacuum pot for my large cup of coffee, but he instead educated me on a "pour over".   I asked him for his favorite coffee and he suggested a " El Volcan" from the hills of El Salvador. He mentioned the coffee was full-bodied and had a sweet, spicy aftertaste.
Now how cool is it to get a fresh, single-cup of coffee!?
By far the most fun I have had at any coffee shop anywhere. I will also note that both baristas worked very well together in the small shop. All the customers were treated very well. I hope to have another Southwest layover in Phoenix 'cause I will return.
Hearty recommendation here. Walk past the places that serve up burnt up beans and have a "pour over" at Cartel Coffee Lab!

I still like Lux better. Cartel is very appealing, though, to those who know their coffee. The menu is not huge, but it does offer basic, good drinks. 
They have plenty of syrups to flavor your drinks, if that's what you're into.
I like the atmosphere in there, and the bike wheel "art" is pretty interesting and unique.
This place is probably really great to study in, considering the fact that I see a sea of macbook apples every time I walk in here. 
The employees are funny and nice. Anyway, it is definitely worth checking out.

I can't say that I'm impressed by this coffee shop's attitude nor their roasting ability. Back when they first opened in Tempe it was a totally different experience. I used to get Cartel Coffee whole beans regularly, but then I moved away for a period of time. I thought I'd give them a try again as they used to roast pretty good coffee. Well times have changed and they seem to be under the impression that under roasting coffee is a good thing. I purchased 2 12oz bags of beans at $19 for 12oz thinking it was a full 16oz. I guess 12oz is because they are "ultra premium". I took the coffee home and made espresso. The beans gave off a good aroma as it brewed, but the flavor was terrible. Overly sour and acidic in a bad way. The beans were under roasted and also had an inconsistent roast. some beans were almost a light tan color while others were a deeper tan, but none were a full roast. I contacted the shop thru yelp prior to making this review and the owner responded with a diatribe on how I just didn't understand how coffee is made and they'd be happy to educate me the next time I was in. I was told that things I disliked were actually positives. Over all I was treated like I was stupid for even suggesting there was something wrong with their coffee. Not a positive experience and I won't go back. I'd recommend Coffee Rush for a much better customer experience.
Awesome little coffee shop with a great laid back and unique vibe. They have some of the best cold brew and I love that you can buy a growler of it to take home.

Cartel is an excellent, locally-owned coffee roaster and coffee shop. They've also recently added beer to the mix.

I always buy coffee beans from Cartel to make my coffee at home. I also often get a drink at Cartel, but to be honest the brewing can be hit or miss depending on who's on the bar. Sad but true. Maybe a little more training and care is in order. I often end up with a very medicinal-tasting drink if I order in.

As an ex-barista myself, I really like that the workers are not required to wear uniforms. I respect a boss who is secure enough in their brand to let the workers present themselves. 

Major peeve: WHY are the pastries always sitting uncovered on the counter? This is gross and it dries them out. I can't believe it's even legal. There isn't even a sneeze guard. 

I'm glad they expanded the space, but it's still constantly crowded.
Good coffee. Girls who used to work there was very unpleasant, and a horrible barista.

I've been a fan of Cartel for a few years now, discovering their coffee and beer on a previous trip to Arizona. I'm not sure if they make beer anymore, but their coffee shop looks to have blown up. Was it always this big and I just missed it? I swear it was smaller last time I was in town.

So I came back here twice in two days for their drip coffee. It's the most expensive drip I've purchased, something like $3.75 for a 16 ounce cup, but boy is it good. Perhaps some of the best drip coffee I've had, except for San Diego's James Coffee. Cartel doesn't have stevia, which is disappointing, but they have all the other staples for customizing your coffee.

I'm glad I don't live in Tempe as this would be an expensive habit! Next time I'm in town I'm totally picking up a bag of beans, though!

Their coffee will get you woken up REAL QUICK

Great place to meet friends! Or do some homework, internet browsing, if thats your thing. I used to go here to have a beer/coffee and download music.

Be careful where you park in their lot because there are some parking spaces limited to 1-hr only but some do not have this time limitation imposed

Will return

If you can stand the strong hipster vibe, this is a very solid place for the fresh roasted coffee lover. Yeah they have decent espresso drinks, but your ol cup o joe is where it's at. At home, I use a v60 and don't mind indulging in some good, fresh-roasted coffee, and this happens to be one of the closest locations in the east valley you can get it at. If you're in the shop, you can choose your beans and method of brew (aeropress, v60 and chemex). If you're unsure of choice, the barista is always happy to answer questions.

As far as a place to spend long hours of work or study, probably not the best due to the huge flux of ASU students, minimal outlets and terrible parking. But in the end, this shop stands out for me because it's huge, a great place to hang out where everyone can enjoy a drink - coffee or beer (they also have a variety of beer on top) and my favorite roaster in the valley.
I would love to stop in for some coffee but there isn't anywhere to lock up my bike. I'll keep swinging by in hopes that there will be a bike rack soon.
Great place to grab a coffee and Focus not too much noice. Great music and fast coffee! I got a iced mocha and it was fresh!! Will return! Also FREE WIFI! Great atmosphere

My husband snuck over here to grab a cup of coffee while we waited on our flight in the cushy chairs next door at a taco shop. (Things you can only get away with in an airport). He got a simple latte and it was pretty decent. This is a local coffee chain. They take their time with their product. My husband observed them making the espresso and it was almost like somebody setting up for a science experiment the way they meticulously prepared to pull the shot. They even put a pretty little design on the top of the latte which only takes a moment but is definitely appreciated. I would definitely stop here the next time I'm in the Southwest terminal area.

I go to the Tempe location often since I'm usually at Cowtown or Casey's right around the corner, and it's a great place to run in and grab a drink or sit for a while and chat.  I met a friend there not too long ago who, surrounded by $900 bikes and dozens of Mac books reflecting in Ray Bans, proclaimed that she was "not cool enough" to be there.  However, after a while of smelling the freshly brewed coffee and taking in the unique art, she changed her mind.

Try the dirty whore.  It's a house-made horchata with a shot of espresso.  YEEEEES.

Simply wonderful to find pour overs and a real espresso machine with real baristas and amazing beans. I was kind of in shock...

My latte was very good, though there could have been more attention to the milk pour- it was a little sloppy. My travel companion had some lovely latte art in his a short while later though. The Morning Glory gluten free muffin was excellent. Go, you won't be sorry.

How many times does it take to remember an order?

I ordered a decaf iced latte, and handed my card to the employee. He put my credit card in the chip reader and then walked off and didn't come back so I had to reach over and grab my card out of the chip reader. 

One minute later, he hollers over the counter, what did you order again? So I said, "A decaf iced latte." Then he nodded and went back to supposidly make my coffee. Nope, he comes back and says, I forgot again, what did you want? - "A decaf iced latte."

Thought that was the end but nope, he asked one more time if I wanted decaf or regular. 
(If you can't remember, I always find it helpful to write it down.)

Let's just say that I finally got my drink but it wasn't good anymore because I had a horrible taste in my mouth after that whole ordeal.

I hang out here on a regular basis (at least 2 days a week, sometime 3-4). Their coffee is great and the staff is friendly. The atmosphere is inviting and the constantly changing artwork they display adds a nice touch. 

They would get 5 stars if their wifi connection wasn't so finicky. Wifi to a coffee shop is like the air in our lungs. It's a shame that they haven't added some simple monitoring tools that can easily throttle bandwidth hoggers or get things right to make a reliable wireless network. If you can't manage your network setup yourself, hire a professional that will do it right.

Interesting little place! A hole in the wall of sorts. The employees were friendly and chatty, very willing to help. Quite knowledgeable about coffee which was fun to listen to. The order taker suggested the Cobb salad which I got. He mentioned that the dressing was his and it was award winning so I assume he is the owner (he wasn't cooking). Salad did not disappoint!!! So savory with the fried egg and the dressing was light. Havarti inside was exceptional as well. Salad did have more pepper than I prefer. Cappuccino was flavorful but a tad bitter. Regardless, I will be back.

I really like this place - but more for the food rather than beverages - though if you want a jolt of caffeine that will leave you as wired as a cyborg plugged into a 220 outlet, I can vouch the cold brew coffee is just the thing.

I can't yet vouch for the gluten-free organicky bakery goods which I haven't tried  but the carne asada chicken protein wrap or bowl and the terriyaki chicken bowl are absolutely exceptional and both less than $10 with tax.  Both these and other offerings from the "protein menu" are available as wrap or bowl. The wraps are absolutely enormous, of original Chipoodle proportions, and the bowl version is a vast, almost overwhelmingly generous serving of tender, moist meat, perfectly cooked (or steamed?) carrot, broccoli, cauliflower, and I don't know what other vegetables, and brown rice or quinoa in a savory sauce that is neither overwhelming nor dull.  It's a limited food menu but that just makes the choices a little easier and given the taste and apparent quality (and quantity) of my first 3 meals here, I'm looking forward to trying everything on the menu, including some rather pricey but I'd guess maniacally healthy smoothies.   

The place is a blend of modern minimalism and warmer, more welcoming reclaimed wood.  The establishment, the staff, and the background music are all  young and hip, neither of which am I, but staff is friendly and I've I've always been made to feel welcome, and the music is indeed sufficiently "background"
that you don't have to yell to place your order and you can still think while you eat - or you can just eat.  

I hear some people go to Cartel just for the coffee; they're missing out. 

Note limited hours at this downtown Phoenix location of 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Cartel Coffee Lab Old Town Scottsdale is a quaint little hipster coffee shop in the north side of the 5th Ave. Shop district of downtown Scottsdale. The place was clean and quiet, with ample seating as well as a shared courtyard patio to the west. For all of the time it had been there, I had never known, since it gets hidden in the location.

The staff was very friendly. The service was fast, and I had my beverage and muffin in no time at all. I'm torn about the whole get your own lid thing, since my drink was full to the top and it was awkward juggling my stuff, the drink and the lid and straw. Eventually I got myself coordinated.

I ordered a blueberry muffin and a large iced chai.  The 16oz. Chai was underwhelming at a whopping 5 bucks! (even overpriced Starbucks has the Grande, 16oz. At $3.65) The muffin was tasty, with nice crusty sugar on top. A bit dry, but still pleasant.

I don't know that I would spend the money for a substandard chai in the future.  While I like to support local businesses and avoid the Starbucks monster, I think I will keep looking for that right place.

Great coffee and other drinks at a premium price and tiny sizes. Typical "hipster" vibe with the reclaimed garbage art, bicycle wheel fixtures, and a general hand made look and feel. Service is a hit or miss. Some of the employees are sweet and helpful, others seem to look down upon you like they are some sort of Coffee bean royalty. 
Slightly overrated but the drinks, and that's what's important, are really great! I love their chai tea. They just need to work on the generally trendy aura that's given off the second you walk in and lower the prices slightly, or up the sizes a bit, either or.
I see what the hype is about cool place with good service, great coffee and chill vibe. I'll definitely be back soon!

i needed a hip place to put together a study group at and everyone in that study group to think i was hella cool as a result. close to campus and totally a gem for those that don't know or haven't been. nice study area towards the back with the garage door open to allow for natural, eco-friendly air circulation.

the line gets backed up pretty bad because they only have like one or two people working there. and everyone in there knows those people, so they get to chatting instead of pouring my americano. and questioning my capability to handle a large (4 shot) americano. i'm a fucking college student, you could probably cut my coffee with cocaine and i wouldn't notice the difference.  

a large americano was $3 and tasted like pure espresso bean bliss. i put cream in it, but really, it didn't need anything. it was perfect in all of its cartel special bean ways. my friend got a soy vanilla latte which i tried and it was perfectly balanced. usually there is either too much soy, or too much vanilla, but the cartel coffee crew knows how to correctly mix and pour coffee and additives.  

while service may not be there strong point, cartel keeps the doors open by serving the best espresso in town with the most urban vibe inside.

The coffee is great and the atmosphere is very arty and open. I do like working from the back with the large bench seats and open room. It really does make the energy there more collaborative and connected. It is also nice to see exactly where the coffee is roasted and the entire process happens there too! Pretty cool place to spend a morning or afternoon.

First time here based on Yelpers and was truly disappointed. The cold brew was too acidic and tastes like old coffee. They can't make ice macchiato, which was kind of shocking. The atmosphere is cool with a nice vibe. The decor is unique and cool. As for service, it was pleasant, nothing too exceptional. Sadly, I will not come back. Moving on to find a better coffee place while in Phoenix.
I don't see the hype. It seems like a hipster hangout.There is no carmel macchiato.The services was not top notch.wasted 6 bucks.......its a shame

Hipster central. Cartel gets packed with students "studying" and bloggers on their laptops all day everyday. I'm sure people can get a lot of work done here, but I can't. Too many opportunities to people watch! I usually get an iced toddy or a one-and-one. I try and sit at the bar so I can get a full view/earful of what everyone is up to. Never a dull moment!

They apparently don't carry hazelnut or caramel syrup which I feel is absurd because those are the most basic flavored. I settled for a hot vanilla latte "for here". Got an iced latte to go instead. Decided not to say anything and try it instead, it was extremely subpar. Parking limit here is an hour and a half so not an ideal place to get caught up on homework. Does not live up to the hype, regret not making the drive to Lux.

I found this place while on vacation and it turns out it's a favorite for locals. Thank you yelp! Anyways, I always have trouble ordering coffee because I don't like it too bitter and the cashier helped me find a sweet drink that was awesome. I've never seen a cold toddy on a menu before and it was great to try one. The customer service was excellent!

I'm from NYC/NJ area, and addicted to good espresso.
I'd found this place while I'm transferring my flight to Las Vegas.
The place looks hip and cool, so I had to try their espresso.

Taste so GOOD, and it was so smooth with full aromatic flavor.
Thus, I had to come back on my way back.

I came back for quality espresso for myself, so I highly recommend to y'all.

When I first came to this place I was kinda surprised seeing those antelope heads on the wall. Although it kinda freaked me out a little in the beginning, it wasn't all that bad. Pretty nice actually. Place is neat and atmosphere is good too. Had a latte and breakfast burrito and it was really good. Their tea is also something. I really like this place alot.

Astonishing coffee paired with different kinds of cake depending on your taste budge. I have tried this place couple of times and my favorite cake to order is the banana loaf cake. Highly recommended!

Cartel is a coffee world unto itself for downtown Tempe, which is void of many non-alcoholic places to hang out.  Situated in what seems to be a motel from the outside and a garage on the inside, Cartel can satiate your brass tax coffee fix and your espresso lust for reasonable prices.  

The coffee is great.  Period.  They roast the beans themselves, know way too much about coffee and are proud.  The espresso, in whatever form you get it in, is rich and nutty.  The toddy (cold brewed iced coffee) is strong to the point of me jittering out the door from a small one.  The teas are various and steeped in a cool manner and timed according to their type.  The vibe can come off a little pretentious sometimes with all their rules and such, but they are selling a great product and the rules help distinguish them from the crowd.

I like to hangout here for an hour every week or so, good people watching, the pretentious guy behind the counter is good to listen to if you want to hear people getting so-so advice that they didn't ask for and my professors come here so it is a good place to catch them not in work mode.

My only complaint is that they need to find a way to get a bike rack closer to the door.  My only other complaint is that they could have more snacks available, I would love to dip something baked in their coffee.

If you are someone who likes good coffee, and enjoy the trendy hipster atmosphere, Cartel Coffee is the best place in the Phoenix area. Their big store off Mill and University smells of roasting coffee beans, they have baristas that are truly artists of coffee making. 

They have some of the best espresso I have ever had, and I have never had a bad customer service experience. They aren't over the top friendly like those Brothers from Amsterdam (hint, hint)  but if the coffee isn't to my liking they have always fixed it without giving me any grief or the typical eye roll. Whenever I have a friend or business colleague that knows their coffee, I always bring them to Cartel. 

The atmosphere is very welcoming at all of their locations. Each store has a specific unique theme to it,  which gives each store their own personality. To me, this is the best coffee in Phoenix.

This Wi-Fi cafe is a popular local hangout with a large and spacious interior and lots of outlets for laptops. The vibe is hipsterish with a local following, and the norms include busy foot traffic and people socializing and studying at every turn. They usually roast their beans in the middle of the day, so the deep coffee aroma can be very enticing before you step inside. I'm usually here with my laptop, and the convenience of parking in the back has allowed me to come here for casual and important meetings.

I had a small cup of Pilar ($4) that came from Guatemala with a crisp and airy consistency but a little bitter, chalky, and heavy on the finish. The added soymilk did not dissolve easily, prompting me to wish that they had handcrafted along with the pour over. The price was higher than Blue Bottle or Philz, so naturally I had to expect more from this drip.

I also tried a large cup of Soy Latte ($5) with Borbollon, a Salvadoran bean that tasted smooth, silky, complex, and easy at the finish. The soy consistency was creamy and not watery like some other places. I prefer the Latte than the pour over.

Service was friendly, responsive, and fairly consistent on every visit. Despite its popularity, their quality still a step behind some of the better handcrafted coffee places. A good place for studying and Yelping, I hope to eventually check out their downtown location.

This was the worst coffee I've ever had, I could've made a better cup in a motel 6 room. It wasn't hot, and very bitter. Ordered 2 different things, a latte and a mocha, both were gross. The sign said "best coffee in Phoenix" more like "worst coffee in the US."

Excellent atmosphere for a cup of coffee and light conversation or to get some work done. They have a seating area for about 30 inside and another area between their suite and another for about 15 or so people.

This is a spin off from their Tempe location that keeps expanding and is a huge hit by the campus.
Usually love this place.   But I'm now almost 30 minutes into waiting for my cappuccino.  Saw them pour my milk 10 minutes ago which means warm when frothing.     Unacceptable.
Can't stand Southwest or Terminal 4.  The only saving grace is Cartel.  Regular at 5th Avenue but the coffee at the airport is great too.

Oh Cartel. I've had quite the love affair with their iced agave latte ever since a friend of mine introduced it to me. It's always been a great place to go and work when you need to get out of the office, I feel like everytime I'm there I see a few people I know. If you haven't tried this place definitely give it a shot. I know I'll miss it.
Coffee pretty good- not giving it 5 stars as the lack of outlets was kind of annoying and the chairs not so comfortable- a studenty hang out and not that clean . Friendly enough though

Love this place. Coffee is great, and staff is friendly and fun. Careful though--if you're running short on time, this isn't the quick grab-and-go coffee stop. They make your drinks with love, and that takes a few extra minutes. Also have great pastries!

Love their Lattes! The yogurt/fruit/granola parfait a healthy and filling snack. The no paper receipt,. but we will e-mail or text you....a BIG Fail! Not only did I not get an E-mail receipt for my company expense report but my E-mail request authored on their website asking for one was also ignored!

I love the coffee, but don't go to a paperless receipt system until you can support it properly!

I will probably try the Cartel again, but will not leave the facility until I receive the receipt in some manner!

Mostly visit Cartel in Scottsdale and the PHX location
Always a 5 always on their game
Never have had just a fast pour
Each latte is hand steamed and slow poured
Top 2 coffee shop In The area
Thanks for the great coffee and service

After close to 200 Cartel Coffees over the last 5 years
I finally give a review.
One of the top coffee houses in the country
You Cappuccino is the standard everyone
is measured too

Traveling can make you thirsty and coffee isn't a thirst quencher, but its a delicious treat . I found cartel coffee lab while driving through Scottsdale. The latte is outstanding it has an undertone of caramel. If your ever in Scottsdale treat yourself to a fantastic coffe with very eclectic people.

I am on a coffee tour of Phoenix and the surrounding areas.  My drink of choice is the iced mocha and theirs is delicious.  The perfect blend of coffee and sweet.  I had the small and it hot the spot. The atmosphere is a cool, industrial look and it had plenty of seating and wasn't too loud to do a little reading. I recommend!

If I were judging this place on their coffee alone, it would receive 5 stars. They're one of the few places in Phoenix (third-wave coffee shops) who source, roast and brew their beans well.

But I am judging it on grounds of environment (2/5 stars) and coffee (5/5 stars).

That being said, the environment is lacking. There are nearly no comfortable places to sit. Very few outlets for laptop charging. Slightly annoying music, and a continuous chatter of deep-voiced businessmen and women (at least when I visit, around 9 or 10 am). Maybe it's just me, but I really enjoy having a comfy bench or couch to do my homework on.

Simply put: If I'm looking to grab a cup of coffee and go, or to chat with someone over a cup of coffee, then Cartel is great. If I'm looking to hole up and focus on homework for a while, I'll probably go somewhere else.

Coffee suggestion: Try the One & One. A shot of espresso and a (correctly made) macchiatto (a shot of espresso with a bit of foam.)

UPDATE: Their rating has moved up to 4 stars, from 3. They got cushions for their hard concrete seats, and the music has improved greatly.
Very good coffee. Surprised given the airport location. Could have used a bigger one but very smooth slight berry overtones. Had a small americano $3.50

Hipster heaven. Bring on the 1920s era boots with dungarees to match. 

Really cool space. A terrific, vintage roaster is prominently displayed and obviously used. 

There is clearly a craft coffee shortage in my hometown. A line was nearly out the door. 

I scored an espresso. It was served up effectively and efficiently. In my humble opinion, the coffee was good...not great. A little too much fruit/acid. Not enough chocolatey smoothness. But, that's my taste. Not necessarily everyone else's cup o' tea!

However, my girl ordered a pour-over. And, pour-overs take a while. But, after ten minutes of waiting, we asked. Oh! We forgot about your pour-over coffee! Just wait another ten minutes. Derrrr...I don't want to wait another ten but I guess I have to cuz my girl is a caffeine junkie and so am I. Can't function without the wonderful stuff. 

I got to taste my girls cup o' joe and it was delicious. 

All in all, they have a good thing going but need to tweak a couple of things. I would return.

4/5 favorite part of the airport

i fondly remember finding the downtown location on a long walk from the office i used to work from when i was in consulting - it was like oh whoa! and then suddenly there it was in my terminal.

it's an efficient operation, and i'm thankful that in between the stress of traveling i can get great caffeinated beverage. on a recent visit, i also opted for a bag of beans as i knew i was running low, and if you grab a bag they cover your coffee for free! the sandwiches are tasty, but definitely also airport priced.

Delicious coffee. Seriously a pain in the ass to get. So many hipsters and laptop jockeys that my bf and I couldn't find an open seat at 2 on a Sunday afternoon. So yeah, coffee is really delicious but not sure it's worth the trouble.

If you've ever wished that an airport would have a great local coffee joint- this is the place you were hoping for. Tremendous cold brew. The location downtown is great as well. Never had an unsatisfactory coffee here.

There's nothing I love more than a cozy coffee shop. In Saint Louis, you can toss a quarter and hit a coffee shop, here however, it's a little more sparse....maybe a handful of quarters and you can hit a Starbucks. There's nothing wrong with Starbucks, as the owner of Cartel Coffee told us, "there's a time for Starbucks and there's a time for a fresh, good pour". I like her. I like this place. It works. 

    The decor is bare bones, industrial-esque and I love it. Two chaises by the front windows are good for lounging and beyond that, there are wooden tables, replica wooden stumps, and some outside patio seating on the side as well. It's simple, it's down to earth, and you can get a damn good cup of coffee. Their dirty chai is wonderful, the fresh pours are delicious and truthfully, the pastries I've been eying are getting harder and harder to resist. They also have a variety of beers and wines to pick from if you're working from home, grading some papers or just really need that end of the day drink. 

   They've been featured by BBC Travel and Food and Wine Magazine which means, maybe I'm not the only one who thinks this place is a freakin' gem in Scottsdale. I wish there were even more coffee spots like this, but I can't deny my affections for Cartel. Don't miss out on a great cup of coffee and a perfect opportunity to people watch!

The mocha here is delicious! It was one of the best mochas I've ever had. It wasn't overly chocolatey & it had a unique aftertaste. I also tried the cold brew & aero pressed coffee (with Maravilla coffee from Guatemala). Both were very good. The shop's unique because there's a side outdoor area with seats and lounge furniture & also a backroom where people predominantly study. I like the segregation of the dining spaces because it allows for people who want to talk be separated from people who want to read/study. A bag of beans here costs around $19. They serve pour over and chemex coffee as well. They also seem to serve some alcohol.
Came here to visit the wife's ASU alma mater and wound up in Cartel. It's a roasting facility as well and offers a wide variety of flavors for the experienced coffee snob. Very tasty!

I've been here a couple of times before but just grabbed a coffee to meet up with someone. Today I decided to try working remotely here from my laptop and was disappointed in numerous things....First of all there was jelly and crumbs on the table where I wanted to setup so I grabbed a napkin and cleaned it off myself. No biggy, maybe they had a busy breakfast and hadn't gotten to cleaning yet. So I setup and noticed there were no power outlets near any of the tables so I had to move to the bench area with no table as that was the only power outlet I saw. There was still a few plates and cups left from the previous customers but I just moved them down a bit and got to working. An hour passes and the girls behind the counter have been so loud laughing and talking about snapchat to each other that they haven't even come out from behind the counter to clean any of the tables or the mess that has been sitting for who knows how long now. They can't be too busy at this point because I am 1 of 4 patrons in the whole place but it is almost lunch time and you would think they would want to get the place clean and ready for the new customers. Finally the barista comes over and cleans all of the empty plates and cups but doesn't actually wipe any of the space down. The wifi cut out at least 3 times while I was working so there really is no reason for me to go back to this place. There are other coffee shops in the area that have comparable coffee, better service and accommodate guests wanting to work from their laptops.

Funky and has culture but scales to airport level too.  I've no clue how they do that but if I didn't have an open mind I would have assumed anything airport isn't worth pursuit.  Glad I transcended but b forewarned, if driving the parking is limited.

Went in for a quick after-lunch coffee. I thought I'd been to Cartel (a different location) before but I couldn't find my review... anyway, it was decent, but I'm not seeing the hype. 
I got a macchiato - espresso with steamed milk - and it came in a TINY little tea cup. When I ordered, the cashier said they only make it "traditional" and I had no idea why he said that to me like I didn't know what I was ordering... I'm sure they get a lot of people in that expect the crÃ¨me-laden chocolate monstrosity that Starbucks will give you if you ordered a mocha macchiato there. However, I hated that he presumed I had no clue what I wanted. With it, I got a chocolate chip cookie - which was larger than your average cookie and undercooked to perfection - but not really worth the price tag.

The cookie was $3 (yikes) and the espresso $3. Mom's mocha was another $3.  

Now, I appreciate that they roast their own coffees here so you get a wholly unique flavour but my espresso was really bitter. Like, medicine bitter. I like a super strong roast flavour but I want it to also be smooth and flavourful. This was neither. Mom agreed about her mocha. 

3 stars for effort, environment (the window paintings were awesome and plenty of comfortable seating) and a great cookie but I wouldn't come back.

Just tried my first ever pour over, created by the very knowledgable and helpful Jesse who was happy to teach this wannabe connoisseur more about his craft. I was certainly not disappointed by the rich, but mild notes this method produces. Definitely recommend.

Pretty delicious coffee.  I ordered a cappuccino and it was splendid.  Definitely woke me which is what I like.  Also,  very reasonably priced.  The whole beer and coffee was a little confusing but you do you cartel. Pretty nice it brews it's own beers and roasts its own coffee.
First time visit.  I enjoyed my Chai.  Nice atmosphere.  I think prices are a bit high when compared to Starbucks and other similar places like Dutch Bros.

I hope that Cartel sticks it out to make a lasting impression in dtphx.  There new larger space is nice, but they need to focus on making the staff friendly and knowledgeable of the area.  The coffee speaks for itself - amazing.. The atmosphere - cool.  I like that you will find the ultimate of hipster sitting next to a dressed to the nines lawyer.  I only hope they continue to pump out great coffee and just work to make the staff a bit more friendly.

Love this shop. The location is wonderful and the atmosphere is very charming. Love all the drinks and the friendly employees. Also really like how their is separate seating if you need a quieter area. Their lattes and brewed teas are my favorite!
OMG... Best coffee ever! Drinking a "Mullet" made by Mr. Mullet himself! Sooo good! Please open up a lab in NorCal!!!!

I am not a hipster, and this place is full of them...  However, if you like good, black, drip coffee, there is no place better than this.  They have a lot of choices, and they have new ones to try all the time.  I'm not much of an espresso drinker, I've never once ordered an espresso drink from them.  Good drip coffee is something hard to find.  Expect to spend at least 10-15 minutes in there, they use things like the V60 or the aeropress to brew their coffee when you order it.  The iced toddy is great too.

Great coffee shop with unbelievable varieties for Phoenix.  Latte was supreme.  A little confusing with two shops in one space, pay for food at another register.  Overall very happy I found this place on a brisk morning downtown.

They have my heart with their cappuccino (not to mention the guy made a heart on top of it!!). Great decoration and a place to hang around with a good conversation, book and a tasty, aromatic cup of coffee!

Stop here and get a delicious cup of coffee or espresso drink, then grab some beans for home to improve your mornings wherever your destination. I picked up a couple pounds of perfectly roasted whole beans here to bring with me while visiting family in Florida. Thank you Cartel Coffee Lab for sparing me 2 weeks of insufferable dunkin doughnuts coffee while stuck on the gulf coast.

Sorry to disappoint the 4 and 5 star reviewers here but having had the Cartel coffee and espresso I must say that coffee drinking is all about taste, not production of it. I'm glad to see that Cartel promotes its principles and passion but its taste leaves some desiring a good cup of coffee or espresso. To me, all I've tried at Cartel tasted sour and bitter at the same time. Now, I'm not a friend of the over-roasted coffee at *$s but I always crave a cup of good coffee when I'm on the run. And this one ain't it. Time to try other Mom-n-Pop coffee shops around.

Nestled in the C gates area at Sky Harbor's terminal 4, this place is worth checking out, even if you had to walk from A (as I did). It's a small space, but packed with the goods, including whole beans, food, and the full array of coffee drinks you'd expect. 

I selected a latte to drink and a cookie to eat at the provided stools and tables, and a couple of bags of beans to go. The latte was creamy and very mild, maintaining a distinctly strong coffee note while also being free of any bitterness. It was positively delicious. The peanut butter cookie was fresh, big and delicious, with a good crumb and a deep, rich peanut butter taste. 

After getting back home, I dug into the beans. My selections were Las Galeras from Colombia (promising "red grape and cocoa, with a long finish") and San Agustin from El Salvador (touting "effervescent blackberry compote and vanilla"). Both were very good examples of their respective countries' products; the Colombian tended to be a little strong with a noticeable, but not overbearing, acidity, where as the El Salvadoran was very smooth and mild, with the vanilla notes definitely showing through. The latter, in particular, was an incredible pour from my French press. 

This place is definitely worth a try, and they're right there at the airport. Your Fitbit will love you for taking the walk, and you taste buds will love you for drinking the coffee!

Overpriced. Wait time is at least 15 min for only two simple iced lattes. I like to try different coffee places other than Starbucks and I have never had an Iced Vanilla Latte taste "sour" not impressed. Would not go back.

I'm so happy I found you! I felt like I was on vacation while I was hanging out there, it was such a nice change from all the corporate coffee places. 

Really cool space, friendly owner and wonderful cappuccino.

Thanks Cartel and Yelp!

Pros: Good Coffee at an airport. 
Cons: Not a lot of places to sit. 

When I saw that the phoenix airport had a "quality" coffeeshop- I was very dubious about its quality. I was pleasantly surprised by Cartel Coffee Lab. They have unique coffee as well as various espresso drinks including one&one which was explained to me as a shot of their espresso and a macchiato. Unfortunately that was only available for "for here" and when I was ordering, there were no open spots to sit at. Therefore, I ordered a 12 ounce Lamari. It was a pour over coffee that met all  expectations. It took about 5 minutes to make. The flavor notes were "Plum and cane sugar with a long aftertaste"- it definitely was a relatively sweet coffee and it was extraordinary smooth. I did not even feel the need to add cream or sugar to the drink. 
Ironically, once I finally got my drink, a lot of seats had opened up so I enjoyed my coffee there. After finishing my drink- I decided to buy a bag of their coffee beans. They only had 12 ounce packages and not all coffee beans were offered. I chose the honey processed beans as it seemed like a very interesting concept. When buying, they actually offered me a free Cold Brew. I took it with me to drink on the plane and again, the cold brew met all expectations. If I find myself again in the Phoenix airport I will definitely come to gate C11 for a cup of coffee.

I'm not downtown often so when I was in the area for a workshop I was excited to check out the 1st Street Cartel location.
